commit_message:
Support no affinity instance reservation

In the previous patch, `affinity=True` policy is enabled for instance
reservation. This patch enables `affinity=None` policy as the default
affinity policy by changing the query_available_hosts() function to
return a list that allows duplicate hosts and by changing the DB
schema to allow null affinity value.

The release note is coming in a follow up patch.

Change-Id: I615dc02c1e42267945996b20ea52cfa7f48f35f1
Blueprint: no-affinity-instance-reservation

commit_message:
Temporarily disable dynamic_routing and bgpvpn from scenario004

Upstream dynamic_routing project has switched to os-ken. To implement
this change we are disabling exercising dr adn bgpvpn which requires it
to fix packaging, get new package promoted and then fix puppet-neutron
to use the right bgp_speaker_driver.

Change-Id: Ia9f2c4a9bca926a9c7a61fd49ca1005708478e25

commit_message:
Normalise in-repo GPG key implementation

To ensure that we have a consistent implementation
between the galera_client and galera_server roles,
we change the galera_server role to match galera_client
as was done in I520ccbadf3320b0d07fc83e3dbec9ea2bd16ec83

This updates it to a mechanism which will be easier to
maintain.

Change-Id: I7ac1a5e3a05aa3d0b4fae86c4a325ef147a9a528
(cherry picked from commit c2b73bff5229257ab5b976f503b9ef21531600f7)

commit_message:
Switch to cirros 0.4.0

This supports ext4 partitions with metadata_csum(as created
by ubuntu bionic by default).

Also Using it with the e1000 virt driver cirros sees the nics.

This allows us to remove 2 of the special cases we had inserted
when the CI jobs were switched to bionic.

Change-Id: I68165110dd57ed314cbc29430f84ff5092065d38
Story: #2004604
Task: #28570
Task: #28499

commit_message:
Use mtu of Tenant network to control neutron global_physnet_mtu

Change: I11e38f82eb9040f77412fe8ad200fcc48031e2f8 introduced mtu
property for composable networks. This change set the MTU of the
Tenant network as the global_physnet_mtu for neutron, unless the
NeutronGlobalPhysnetMtu is overridden. The default MTU used if
no MTU is defined for the Tenant network is 1500. (The same
default was previously used for the NeutronGlobalPhysnetMtu
parameter.)

Change-Id: I5e60d52ad571e1cdb3b82cd1d9947e33fa682bf8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/33/612533/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: default: 0 description: | MTU of the underlying physical network. Neutron uses this value to calculate MTU for all virtual network components. For flat and VLAN networks, neutron uses this value without modification. For overlay networks such as VXLAN, neutron automatically subtracts the overlay protocol overhead from this value. (If this is not changes TenantNetPhysnetMtu will be used.) TenantNetPhysnetMtu: type: number (The mtu setting of the Tenant network in network_data.yaml control's this parameter.) global_physnet_mtu_unset: {equals: [{get_param: NeutronGlobalPhysnetMtu}, 0]} neutron::global_physnet_mtu: if: - global_physnet_mtu_unset - {get_param: TenantNetGlobalPhysnetMtu} - {get_param: NeutronGlobalPhysnetMtu}

commit_message:
Ensure ssh client is available for rsync

This is in a seperate package on ubuntu/centos systems and bundled
in openssh on suse. The ssh client was missing on centos so this
patch ensures it is always present for all distributions.

Change-Id: I4885f88938bd49ae81ce8f0a85fde46ddbe311a4

subject: Add MTU to neutron networks and nic-config templates
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-09-04 13:08:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/fad566cb3c85c53085cfcc8b9f924484a8cb0818', 'message': "Add MTU to neutron networks and nic-config templates

Neutron has support[1] to set the guaranteed MTU for
networks and network segments so that this is exposed
to plug-ins. In interest of supporting the use of
plug-ins to configure network devices in the future
this change adds MTU property on neutron networks.

The new (optional) property 'mtu' in the network
defenitions in 'network_data.yaml' is used to control
the MTU settings. By default the mtu is '1500'.

We already configure the MTU on the ctlplane neutron
networks, this adds the MTU to composable networks.

Also update the nic-config sample templates to include
mtu settings. A heat value resource is added to
nic-config templates to get the required minimum MTU
value for bridges, bonds and member interfaces to
ensure the MTU is large enough to allow the largest
configured MTU to traverse the path.

Closes-Bug: #1790537
Change-Id: I11e38f82eb9040f77412fe8ad200fcc48031e2f8

Change-Id: I11e38f82eb9040f77412fe8ad200fcc48031e2f8
"}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2018-09-04 22:59:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/9c9536a6f4482ee4dcbc8079bd9244f3c2861066', 'message': "Add MTU to neutron networks and nic-config templates

Neutron has support[1] to set the guaranteed MTU for
networks and network segments so that this is exposed
to plug-ins. In interest of supporting the use of
plug-ins to configure network devices in the future
this change adds MTU property on neutron networks.

The new (optional) property 'mtu' in the network
defenitions in 'network_data.yaml' is used to control
the MTU settings. By default the mtu is '1500'.

We already configure the MTU on the ctlplane neutron
networks, this adds the MTU to composable networks.

Also update the nic-config sample templates to include
mtu settings. A heat value resource is added to
nic-config templates to get the required minimum MTU
value for bridges, bonds and member interfaces to
ensure the MTU is large enough to allow the largest
configured MTU to traverse the path.

Closes-Bug: #1790537
Change-Id: I11e38f82eb9040f77412fe8ad200fcc48031e2f8
"}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2018-09-17 16:28:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/b344481c9049e4b64070ba35ad38295c2ea301cd', 'message': "Add MTU to neutron networks and nic-config templates

commit_message:
Add MTU to neutron networks and nic-config templates

Neutron has support[1] to set the guaranteed MTU for
networks and network segments so that this is exposed
to plug-ins. In interest of supporting the use of
plug-ins to configure network devices in the future
this change adds MTU property on neutron networks.

The new (optional) property 'mtu' in the network
defenitions in 'network_data.yaml' is used to control
the MTU settings. By default the mtu is '1500'.

We already configure the MTU on the ctlplane neutron
networks, this adds the MTU to composable networks.

Also update the nic-config sample templates to include
mtu settings. A heat value resource is added to
nic-config templates to get the required minimum
viable MTU value for bridges, bonds and member
interfaces to ensure the MTU is large enough to allow
the largest configured MTU to traverse the path.

Closes-Bug: #1790537
Change-Id: I11e38f82eb9040f77412fe8ad200fcc48031e2f8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/93/599593/17 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ControlPlaneMtu: default: 1500 description: The maximum transmission unit (MTU) size(in bytes) that is guaranteed to pass through the data path of the segments in the network. (The parameter is automatically resolved from the ctlplane network's mtu attribute.) type: number {{network.name}}Mtu: default: {{network.mtu}} description: The maximum transmission unit (MTU) size(in bytes) that is guaranteed to pass through the data path of the segments in the {{network.name}} network. type: number {%- if network.ipv6|default(false) and network.gateway_ipv6|default(false) %}{%- elif network.gateway_ip|default(false) %}{%- endif %} mtu: get_param: ControlPlaneMtu{%- if network.name not in ["External", "Tenant"] %} {%- if network.name in role.networks %} mtu: get_param: {{network.name}}Mtu{%- endif %} {%- elif network.name in role.networks or role.name == 'Networker' %}{%- if network.name == "External" %}{%- else %}{%- endif %} mtu: get_param: {{network.name}}Mtu{%- if network.name in role.networks %}{%- endif %}{%- if network.name in role.default_route_networks %}{%- endif %} mtu: get_param: {{network.name}}Mtu{%- endif %} {#- This hack gets around Jinja scope limitations to update nics_used within loop. #} {%- set _ = nics_used.append(loop.index) %}

commit_message:
Move link options to a link file

The link options being set within the network files, which functional,
does not expose all of the link capabilities we have within a specific
link file. This change implements link files per network interface
giving the user the ability to customize links as they need.

Change-Id: Ie999c541a6a566141e81c6d9f95b8a30bbbefa8c
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ansible-role-systemd_networkd refs/changes/89/612489/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

A full list # of all options can be found here: # https://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/systemd.link.html # The systemd networkd service can be used to set specific link configuration options. # For more information on all of the possible configuration see # https://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/systemd.link.html systemd_networkd_link: MACAddressPolicy: "persistent"

added_lines: parser.add_argument('--filter', metavar='<query>', help='resource query)') query = parsed_args.filter all_tenants=all_tenants, query=query) class ResourceCount(show.ShowOne): """Show a count of all alarms""" def get_parser(self, prog_name): parser = super(ResourceCount, self).get_parser(prog_name) parser.add_argument('--type', dest='resource_type', metavar='<resource type>', help='Type of resource') parser.add_argument('--all-tenants', default=False, dest='all_tenants', action='store_true', help='Shows resources of all the tenants') parser.add_argument('--filter', metavar='<query>', help='resource query)'), parser.add_argument( '--group-by', dest='group_by', metavar='<group_by>', default='vitrage_type', help='A resource data field, to group by it\'s values'), return parser @property def formatter_default(self): return 'json' def take_action(self, parsed_args): resource_type = parsed_args.resource_type all_tenants = parsed_args.all_tenants query = parsed_args.filter group_by = parsed_args.group_by resource_count = utils.get_client(self).resource.count( resource_type=resource_type, all_tenants=all_tenants, query=query, group_by=group_by) return self.dict2columns(resource_count)

commit_message:
Enhance Vitrage resource APIs

Add a new API for retrieving the number of resources,
 similar to 'vitrage alarm count'.
The API includes filter and group-by options.
Add filter option to 'vitrage resource list'

Story: 2004669
Task: 28650
Task: 28656

Change-Id: I3b9f2be581dcbd4a539b8040a387512b55597953
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/vitrage refs/changes/09/627309/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_log import versionutilsfrom vitrage.api.controllers.v1 import count count = count.ResourceCountsController() def post(self, **kwargs): LOG.info('post list resource with args: %s', kwargs) resource_type = kwargs.get('resource_type', None) all_tenants = kwargs.get('all_tenants', False) all_tenants = bool_from_string(all_tenants) query = kwargs.get('query') try: return self._get_resources(resource_type, all_tenants, query) except Exception: LOG.exception('Failed to list resources.') abort(404, 'Failed to list resources.') @pecan.expose('json') @versionutils.deprecated( as_of=versionutils.deprecated.STEIN, what='rca:list_resources GET', in_favor_of='rca:list_resources POST', ) if kwargs.get('query'): LOG.warning('GET list resources does not supprt query - use POST') abort(404, 'Query argument is not supported by GET, use POST') def _get_resources(resource_type=None, all_tenants=False, query=None): if query: query = json.loads(query) if all_tenants: enforce('list resources:all_tenants', pecan.request.headers, pecan.request.enforcer, {}) else: enforce('list resources', pecan.request.headers, pecan.request.enforcer, {}) LOG.info('received resources list with type filter %s and query %s', resource_type, str(query)) LOG.info('get_resources with type: %s, all_tenants: %s, query: %s', resource_type, all_tenants, str(query)) resources = pecan.request.client.call( pecan.request.context, 'get_resources', resource_type=resource_type, all_tenants=all_tenants, query=query) resources = decompress_obj(resources)['resources'] return resources
deleted_lines: if all_tenants: enforce('list resources:all_tenants', pecan.request.headers, pecan.request.enforcer, {}) else: enforce('list resources', pecan.request.headers, pecan.request.enforcer, {}) LOG.info('received resources list with filter %s', resource_type) def _get_resources(resource_type=None, all_tenants=False): LOG.info('get_resources with type: %s, all_tenants: %s', resource_type, all_tenants) try: resources = \ pecan.request.client.call(pecan.request.context, 'get_resources', resource_type=resource_type, all_tenants=all_tenants) resources = decompress_obj(resources)['resources'] return resources except Exception: LOG.exception('Failed to get resources.') abort(404, 'Failed to list resources.')

commit_message:
Write libvirt logs to host

This modifies the libvirt chart to write logs directly to the
host by default. This also modifies the fluentbit and fluentd
charts to capture libvirt logs from the host and index them into
Elasticsearch

Change-Id: I0bbc49d2c0d4cf4895f797e48f309f308ffd021f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-infra refs/changes/05/626405/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - libvirt: header: input Name: tail Tag: libvirt Path: /var/log/libvirt/libvirtd.log DB: /var/log/libvirt.db Mem_Buf_Limit: 5MB DB.Sync: Normal Buffer_Chunk_Size: 1M Buffer_Max_Size: 1M - libvirt_elasticsearch: header: match type: elasticsearch user: "#{ENV['ELASTICSEARCH_USERNAME']}" password: "#{ENV['ELASTICSEARCH_PASSWORD']}" expression: "libvirt" include_tag_key: true host: "#{ENV['ELASTICSEARCH_HOST']}" port: "#{ENV['ELASTICSEARCH_PORT']}" logstash_format: true logstash_prefix: libvirt buffer_chunk_limit: 2M buffer_queue_limit: 8 flush_interval: "5" max_retry_wait: 300 disable_retry_limit: ""

commit_message:
Use openstackdocstheme

Use openstackdocstheme for consistency with all specs displayed on
specs.openstack.org.

This includes updating requirements to current versions, updating specs
building to not publish dirtrees and tread warnings as errors, update
index page, and update settings for the theme.

Change-Id: I905f404361a98d9af1a4ba5c52b8e04acda1688e

commit_message:
[WIP] Support private registry login

Change-Id: Ic65f177838f254fa9238ec0d8ac9f7f061d03066
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zun refs/changes/37/627737/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Restricting access ================== Create a password file with one entry for the user testuser, with password testpassword:: $ openstack appcontainer run --name registry registry:2 htpasswd -Bbn testuser testpassword Wait for the container to be created. Then, retrieve the output:: $ mkdir auth $ openstack appcontainer logs registry > auth/htpasswd Delete the container $ openstack appcontainer delete registry Run the container:: $ openstack appcontainer create \ --restart always \ --expose-port 443 \ --name registry \ --environment REGISTRY_HTTP_ADDR=0.0.0.0:443 \ --environment REGISTRY_HTTP_TLS_CERTIFICATE=/domain.crt \ --environment REGISTRY_HTTP_TLS_KEY=/domain.key \ --environment "REGISTRY_AUTH=htpasswd" \ --environment "REGISTRY_AUTH_HTPASSWD_REALM=Registry Realm" \ --environment REGISTRY_AUTH_HTPASSWD_PATH=/auth/htpasswd \ --mount type=bind,source=`pwd`/auth/htpasswd,destination=/auth/htpasswd \ registry:2

commit_message:
flatten snmp service configuration

This change combines the previous puppet and docker files into a single
file that performs the docker service installation and configuration.

Depends-On: https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/16994/
Change-Id: I35616168df73d8ae7790816b88d06d5bff9c151a
Related-Blueprint: services-yaml-flattening

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-15 12:50:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-tests/commit/03bb0810f88993df6c99b0e6d844838764e2a5bc', 'message': "Add retry install packages linter

We often fail because of network issues in the gate (and possibly
users who are deploying might run into the same).  We should make it
a priority to always retry when possible.

This patch adds retries to the linter so that we are always retrying
to install packages and block if we're not doing that.

commit_message:
Add retry install packages linter

We often fail because of network issues in the gate (and possibly
users who are deploying might run into the same).  We should make it
a priority to always retry when possible.

This patch adds retries to the linter so that we are always retrying
to install packages and block if we're not doing that.

Change-Id: I7741d1b12415889b9604d17e225d241a5b7e339a

commit_message:
k8s: drop use of master_index

We no longer need to use master_index because we actually just
run the SoftwareDeployment on the first server of the cluster,
which is controlled by Heat.

Change-Id: I762498707d606c6edbdeaa98ce52763837008d00

commit_message:
nova_compute fails to start in tls-everywhere configuration

With tls-everywhere enabled connecting to keystone endpoint fails
to retrieve the URL for the placement endpoint as the certificate
can not be verified. While verification is disabled to check the
placement endpoint later, it is not to communicate with keystone.
This disables certificate verification for communication with
keystone.

Related-Bug: 1784155

Change-Id: I317dd62f3a555f375d540a63c21a6fb38d37ca96
(cherry picked from commit a99820a80cd99690c096553dcdc5e7f7472c02f1)
(cherry picked from commit 14af0677c87a64dd7ad96fad41d74da1db3d8e07)

subject: Change step to start nova placement and make compute wait for it
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-12-06 15:12:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/76a162abb16174f89ccb67074333c4e1c31ea8ae', 'message': "Change step to start nova placement and make compute wait for it

There is a deployment race where nova-placement fails to start if
the nova api db migration have not finished before starting it.
We start nova placement early to make sure it is up before the
nova-compute services get started. Since in HA scenario there is
no sync in between the nodes on the current worked deployment step
we might have the situation that the placement service gets started
on C1/2 when the nova api db sync is not yet finished on C0.

We have two possibilities:
1) start placement later and verify that nova-computes recover correct
2) verify that db migration on nova_api db finished before start nova-
placement on the controllers

2) which was addressed via https://review.openstack.org/610966 showed
problems:
a) the docker/podman container failed to start with some file not found
error, therefore this was reverted in https://review.openstack.org/619607

b) when the scrip were running on different controllers at the same
time, the way how nova's db_version() is implemented has issues, which
is being worked on in https://review.openstack.org/619622

This patch addresses 1) and moves placement service start to step_4
and adds an additional task on the computes to wait until the placement
service is up.

Closes-Bug: #1784155

Change-Id: Ifb5ffc4b25f5ca266560bc0ac96c73071ebd1c9f
(cherry picked from commit cc61ff93ec41e149caba31cc21524f37def4d07e)
(cherry picked from commit 3363bcbf8d7a4c16ec673361adf82c76213e1cbd)
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2018-12-07 08:44:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/f51660bad31778746c8c8af3781454104091fba3', 'message': "Change step to start nova placement and make compute wait for it

2) which was addressed via https://review.openstack.org/610966 showed

a) the docker/podman container failed to start with some file not found

b) when the scrip were running on different controllers at the same

This patch addresses 1) and moves placement service start to step_4

Closes-Bug: #1784155

we might have the situation that the placement service gets started
on C1/2 when the nova api db sync is not yet finished on C0.

We have two possibilities:
1) start placement later and verify that nova-computes recover correct
2) verify that db migration on nova_api db finished before start nova-
placement on the controllers

2) which was addressed via https://review.openstack.org/610966 showed
problems:
a) the docker/podman container failed to start with some file not found
error, therefore this was reverted in https://review.openstack.org/619607

b) when the scrip were running on different controllers at the same
time, the way how nova's db_version() is implemented has issues, which
is being worked on in https://review.openstack.org/619622

This patch addresses 1) and moves placement service start to step_4
and adds an additional task on the computes to wait until the placement
service is up.

Closes-Bug: #1784155

Change-Id: Ifb5ffc4b25f5ca266560bc0ac96c73071ebd1c9f
(cherry picked from commit cc61ff93ec41e149caba31cc21524f37def4d07e)
(cherry picked from commit 3363bcbf8d7a4c16ec673361adf82c76213e1cbd)

commit_message:
Change step to start nova placement and make compute wait for it

There is a deployment race where nova-placement fails to start if
the nova api db migration have not finished before starting it.
We start nova placement early to make sure it is up before the
nova-compute services get started. Since in HA scenario there is
no sync in between the nodes on the current worked deployment step
we might have the situation that the placement service gets started
on C1/2 when the nova api db sync is not yet finished on C0.

We have two possibilities:
1) start placement later and verify that nova-computes recover correct
2) verify that db migration on nova_api db finished before start nova-
placement on the controllers

2) which was addressed via https://review.openstack.org/610966 showed
problems:
a) the docker/podman container failed to start with some file not found
error, therefore this was reverted in https://review.openstack.org/619607

b) when the scrip were running on different controllers at the same
time, the way how nova's db_version() is implemented has issues, which
is being worked on in https://review.openstack.org/619622

This patch addresses 1) and moves placement service start to step_4
and adds an additional task on the computes to wait until the placement
service is up.

Closes-Bug: #1784155

Change-Id: Ifb5ffc4b25f5ca266560bc0ac96c73071ebd1c9f
(cherry picked from commit cc61ff93ec41e149caba31cc21524f37def4d07e)
(cherry picked from commit 3363bcbf8d7a4c16ec673361adf82c76213e1cbd)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/27/623227/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: nova_wait_for_placement_service: start_order: 2 image: *nova_compute_image user: root net: host privileged: false detach: false volumes: - /var/lib/docker-config-scripts/:/docker-config-scripts/ - /var/lib/config-data/puppet-generated/nova_libvirt/etc/nova:/etc/nova:ro command: "/docker-config-scripts/nova_wait_for_placement_service.py" nova_compute: start_order: 3

subject: Update kolla_config to deal with keystone fernet key rotation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-12-21 22:25:54.000000000', 'files': ['docker/services/keystone.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/c61281b502a891570e0ab9e8592f478378c61c62', 'message': 'Update kolla_config to deal with keystone fernet key rotation

The kolla config for the keystone container currently copies over
all of the config area using "merge".  This makes sense for most of
keystone's config, but it causes a problem with the fernet keys
used for creating tokens that are stored in the config area.

Good security practices recommend keys be rotated, and keystone
and tripleo both offer the ability for an operator to trigger key
rotation.  The rotation policy limits the number of previous keys
that are retained, which is 5 by default in a tripleo deployment.
The rotation all occurs on the undercloud, and the new set of keys
is provided to the keystone container via the bind mount used for
our kolla config source.  Due to the use of "merge", old fernet
keys that have been deleted on the undercloud due to the rotation
policy will persist for the keystone container since "merge" skips
deletion of files.

This patch adds a second source for keystone's kolla_config, which
is used specifically for the fernet keys.  The fernet key source
has "merge" set to false, and is restricted to the fernet-keys
subdirectory.  This will ensure that any keys that are no longer
present in the kolla config provided by the undercloud are also not
present in the keystone container.

Change-Id: I83d1bfaba321d2fbd5cad1b8fb9478f788f5e238
(cherry picked from commit 5bff1c5fc9a7dd5cdf9c1027e7c0648f3a6fc5b3)
'}]
commit_message:
Update kolla_config to deal with keystone fernet key rotation

The kolla config for the keystone container currently copies over
all of the config area using "merge".  This makes sense for most of
keystone's config, but it causes a problem with the fernet keys
used for creating tokens that are stored in the config area.

Good security practices recommend keys be rotated, and keystone
and tripleo both offer the ability for an operator to trigger key
rotation.  The rotation policy limits the number of previous keys
that are retained, which is 5 by default in a tripleo deployment.
The rotation all occurs on the undercloud, and the new set of keys
is provided to the keystone container via the bind mount used for
our kolla config source.  Due to the use of "merge", old fernet
keys that have been deleted on the undercloud due to the rotation
policy will persist for the keystone container since "merge" skips
deletion of files.

This patch adds a second source for keystone's kolla_config, which
is used specifically for the fernet keys.  The fernet key source
has "merge" set to false, and is restricted to the fernet-keys
subdirectory.  This will ensure that any keys that are no longer
present in the kolla config provided by the undercloud are also not
present in the keystone container.

Change-Id: I83d1bfaba321d2fbd5cad1b8fb9478f788f5e238
(cherry picked from commit 5bff1c5fc9a7dd5cdf9c1027e7c0648f3a6fc5b3)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/15/627015/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - source: "/var/lib/kolla/config_files/src/etc/keystone/fernet-keys" dest: "/etc/keystone/fernet-keys" merge: false preserve_properties: true

commit_message:
Update kolla_config to deal with keystone fernet key rotation

The kolla config for the keystone container currently copies over
all of the config area using "merge".  This makes sense for most of
keystone's config, but it causes a problem with the fernet keys
used for creating tokens that are stored in the config area.

Good security practices recommend keys be rotated, and keystone
and tripleo both offer the ability for an operator to trigger key
rotation.  The rotation policy limits the number of previous keys
that are retained, which is 5 by default in a tripleo deployment.
The rotation all occurs on the undercloud, and the new set of keys
is provided to the keystone container via the bind mount used for
our kolla config source.  Due to the use of "merge", old fernet
keys that have been deleted on the undercloud due to the rotation
policy will persist for the keystone container since "merge" skips
deletion of files.

This patch adds a second source for keystone's kolla_config, which
is used specifically for the fernet keys.  The fernet key source
has "merge" set to false, and is restricted to the fernet-keys
subdirectory.  This will ensure that any keys that are no longer
present in the kolla config provided by the undercloud are also not
present in the keystone container.

Change-Id: I83d1bfaba321d2fbd5cad1b8fb9478f788f5e238
(cherry picked from commit 5bff1c5fc9a7dd5cdf9c1027e7c0648f3a6fc5b3)

commit_message:
Make galera_client role idempotent

* Because yum-config-manager doesn't have a dry-run
  option or doesn't show a change status, we need
  to rely on something else. The yum_repository
  ansible module can bring the idempotency but
  needs the priorities plugins to be enabled, which
  is what we do here.

* The tox.ini is now switched to test idempotency

* The test playbook is adapted for idempotency

Change-Id: I9a1c30b47caf98f6325706fbb1af6fa38a28d4c7
Co-Authored-By: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe@evrard.me>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-galera_client refs/changes/01/551001/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: TEST_IDEMPOTENCE=true

for network interface to bridge mappings. For each flat/vlan provider
network, a network_interface can be defined that will be added to an OVS
provider bridge automatically. This supercedes the network_interface override
for OVS-based deployments, including OVS, OVS w/ DVR, and OVN, that was

commit_message:
Update provider networks plugin to support multiple network mappings

This patch updates the provider networks plugin by adding support
for network interface to bridge mappings. For each flat/vlan provider
network, a network_interface can be defined that will be added to an OVS
provider bridge automatically. This supercedes the network_interface override
for OVS-based deployments, including OVS, OVS w/ DVR, and OVN, that was
only available outside of the plugin.

Change-Id: I99d95ab103f9d64726a809eb81db69e0b2b18ffb

commit_message:
Fix ServiceNetMap THT file reference

The document shows the ServiceNetMap defaults as being in the
``overcloud.yaml`` file, however, the defaults are actually in
``network/service_net_map.j2.yaml`` file.

Change-Id: I2e57de3cb42a97cb2de1627920572a2ddd4766ed
Closes-Bug: #1708663

commit_message:
Add feature set to test public bond network isolation

Overcloud deployments using public bond network
isolation have been tested downstream previously.
As part of the effort to consolidate upstream and
downstream test settings, this review adds a feature
set for public bond network isolation that should
be able to be used with OVB in both test environments.

Depends-On: Ied543e70491ff85d6fab4371812bca802c6b1032
Depends-On: If1cef78c55041b476103bc028591b72c85cddb6d
Change-Id: I6f669b8588fe14db9166694349e5523a443d70cd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/52/540152/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Summary of the feature set. # Deploy an Openstack environment with ssl undercloud, introspect, # and use public bond network isolation # This enables TLS for the undercloud which will also make haproxy bind to the # configured public-vip and admin-vip. undercloud_generate_service_certificate: true ssl_overcloud: true overcloud_templates_path: /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates step_introspect: true # This enables container deployements after Pike containerized_overcloud: >- {% if release in ['newton', 'ocata', 'pike'] -%} false {%- else -%} true {%- endif -%} delete_docker_cache: true # Tell tripleo about our environment. enable_pacemaker: true network_isolation: true network_isolation_type: "public-bond" network_isolation_args: >- -e {{ overcloud_templates_path }}/ci/environments/network/public-bond/network-isolation-absolute.yaml -e {{ overcloud_templates_path }}/ci/environments/network/public-bond/network-environment.yaml -e {{ working_dir }}/network-environment.yaml # This featureset is extremely resource intensive, so we disable telemetry # in order to reduce the overall memory footprint # This is not required in newton telemetry_args: >- {% if release != 'newton' %} -e "{{ overcloud_templates_path }}/environments/disable-telemetry.yaml" {% endif %} extra_args: >- {% if release not in ['newton', 'ocata', 'pike'] %} -e "{{ overcloud_templates_path }}/ci/environments/ovb-ha.yaml" {% endif %} # keep the doc gen settings at the bottom of the config file. # options below direct automatic doc generation by tripleo-collect-logs artcl_gen_docs: true artcl_create_docs_payload: included_deployment_scripts: - undercloud-install - overcloud-custom-tht-script - "{% if release not in ['newton', 'ocata', 'pike'] -%}overcloud-prep-containers{%- endif -%}" - overcloud-prep-flavors - overcloud-prep-images - overcloud-prep-network - overcloud-deploy - overcloud-deploy-post - overcloud-validate included_static_docs: - env-setup-virt table_of_contents: - env-setup-virt - undercloud-install - overcloud-custom-tht-script - "{% if release not in ['newton', 'ocata', 'pike'] -%}overcloud-prep-containers{%- endif -%}" - overcloud-prep-flavors - overcloud-prep-images - overcloud-prep-network - overcloud-deploy - overcloud-deploy-post - overcloud-validate # Use the traditional ping test in newton, ocata and pike # Run tempest in queens+ test_ping: >- {% if release in ['newton', 'ocata', 'pike'] -%} true {%- else -%} false {%- endif -%} run_tempest: >- {% if release in ['newton', 'ocata', 'pike'] -%} false {%- else -%} true {%- endif -%} test_regex: '' tempest_whitelist: - 'tempest.scenario.test_network_basic_ops.TestNetworkBasicOps.test_network_basic_ops' deploy_steps_ansible_workflow: >- {% if release not in ['newton','ocata','pike'] -%} true {%- else -%} false {%- endif -%} config_download_args: >- {% if release not in ['newton','ocata','pike'] -%} -e /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates/environments/config-download-environment.yaml --config-download --verbose {%- endif -%}

commit_message:
update tempest defaults, move workers to tempest role

tempest_workers should be in the validate_tempest role now
test_tempest is not used
tempest_regex -> test_regex

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-02 14:02:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-upgrade/commit/7915eb104027f659f428a2909a578db2ef5614f0', 'message': '[DNM]: Apply workaround for P->Q upgrades.

Change-Id: Iec3621ad4235e28ffd09f879b1a51db237817dd6
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2018-03-02 14:03:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-upgrade/commit/54c534eef0e045bd559a088c2c865e721eb67f13', 'message': '[DNM]: Apply workaround for P->Q upgrades.

There is an issue at the time of upgrading
from Pike to Queens related to the service
name change from one release to another.
Appending this env file workarounds it until

commit_message:
[DNM]: Apply workaround for P->Q upgrades.

There are two issues at the time of upgrading
from Pike to Queens: one related to the service
name change from one release to another and other
with python-keystoneauth1 that needs to be
updated [0].

Appending this env file and removing keystoneauh1
workarounds it until both issues will get solved.

[0] - https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1533432

Change-Id: Iec3621ad4235e28ffd09f879b1a51db237817dd6

commit_message:
Add CorosyncUpgradeAuthkeySecret for the corosync encryption

This is a shared key that will be used only on upgrades from (O->P) in
order to create /etc/corosync/authkey on all nodes. It is not needed
except on upgrades because pcs with the appropriate encryption flag
takes care of that automagically.

Change-Id: Id066f644e08ac9860c38c22607c55e6da60a1675
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/44/507844/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Cluster authkey needs 128bytes of entropy (1024 bits), so we # use a size of 200 which will give us ~1190 bits elif name.startswith('CorosyncAuthkeySecret'): passwords[name] = passutils.generate_password( size=200)

subject: Discoverable Ironic Drivers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-19 15:24:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ui/commit/db51cbc3b8ba04d50bb17949cfa1079ce76bfc2f', 'message': 'Discoverable Ironic Drivers

Change-Id: Ic5693506e67ca1a54ba88bdb4e6a02be0ebe4644
WIP: kind of working... still need to add forms
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2018-03-20 23:20:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ui/commit/955130257e105a325f4776d71d83f406ac7888a9', 'message': 'Discoverable Ironic Drivers

This patch wires in the ability to discover which drivers are active
in Ironic (via query to /drivers) and only displays the ability to
configure drivers which are currently enabled in Ironic.

Three extra driverFields were also added in this patch. (These are
currently static so that we can easily support language customizations
for the UI). The new additions include Ilo, Redfish, and Iboot.
With the additions of Ilo and Redfish the UI would now support the
same stock settings as our Undercloud with support for Ilo, Redfish,
IPMI, and DRAC.

Co-Authored-By: Jiri Tomasek <jtomasek@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Honza Pokorny <honza@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ic5693506e67ca1a54ba88bdb4e6a02be0ebe4644
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2018-03-20 23:24:25.000000000', 'files': ['src/js/components/nodes/registerNodes/RegisterNodesDialog.js', 'src/js/components/nodes/registerNodes/driverFields/Redfish.js', 'src/js/immutableRecords/drivers.js', 'src/js/components/nodes/registerNodes/RegisterNodesForm.js', 'src/js/components/nodes/registerNodes/driverFields/Ilo.js', 'src/js/constants/DriversConstants.js', 'src/js/components/nodes/registerNodes/driverFields/IBoot.js', 'src/js/reducers/driversReducer.js', 'src/js/services/IronicApiService.js', 'src/js/components/nodes/registerNodes/RegisterNodeFields.js', 'src/js/selectors/drivers.js', 'src/js/components/nodes/registerNodes/driverFields/DriverFields.js', 'src/js/reducers/appReducer.js', 'src/js/actions/DriversActions.js', 'src/js/normalizrSchemas/drivers.js'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ui/commit/fdd181689b88793d1793104c186ff8776c625cb6', 'message': 'Discoverable Ironic Drivers

This patch wires in the ability to discover which drivers are active
in Ironic (via query to /drivers) and only displays the ability to

Three extra driverFields were also added in this patch. (These are

Co-Authored-By: Jiri Tomasek <jtomasek@redhat.com>

'}]
commit_message:
Discoverable Ironic Drivers

This patch wires in the ability to discover which drivers are active
in Ironic (via query to /drivers) and only displays the ability to
configure drivers which are currently enabled in Ironic.

Three extra driverFields were also added in this patch. (These are
currently static so that we can easily support language customizations
for the UI). The new additions include Ilo, Redfish, and Iboot.
With the additions of Ilo and Redfish the UI would now support the
same stock settings as our Undercloud with support for Ilo, Redfish,
IPMI, and DRAC.

Co-Authored-By: Jiri Tomasek <jtomasek@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Honza Pokorny <honza@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ic5693506e67ca1a54ba88bdb4e6a02be0ebe4644
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ui refs/changes/60/554260/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: /** * Ironic API: GET /v1/drivers * @returns {array} of (available) drivers */ getDrivers() { return dispatch => dispatch(this.defaultRequest('/drivers')) .then(response => response.data) .catch(handleErrors); }

commit_message:
[WIP] - Check service_config_settings inheritance

Some services set the service_config_settings parameter, however
it's not inherited by the services/dockers that uses it as
base.

This patch check that the resources has the service_config_settings
are set on the base and whether is set on the dependant service/docker.

Change-Id: I90b3043c5e258a3b7dae1f5cf27ab587c188d561
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/37/555337/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: return validate_inherited_output(filename,tpl) def validate_inherited_output(filename, tpl): returnval = 0 head_path = filename[:filename.rfind("/")+1] if 'resources' in tpl.keys() and tpl['resources']: BASES = tpl['resources'].keys() for base in BASES: if base != "ContainersCommon": base_file = head_path+tpl['resources'][base]['type'] if base_file.endswith('.yaml'): tpl_b = yaml.load(open(base_file).read()) if 'role_data' in tpl_b['outputs'].keys() and tpl_b['outputs']['role_data']: bvalues = tpl_b['outputs']['role_data']['value'].keys() values = tpl['outputs']['role_data']['value'].keys() if 'service_config_settings' in bvalues: if 'service_config_settings' not in values: print ('Warning: The file {} is missing service_config_settings.' 'It\'s seems that is not inherited from the resource {}'.format( filename, base)) returnval = 1 return returnval if filename.startswith('./puppet/services/'): return validate_inherited_output(filename,tpl)

commit_message:
[WIP] Build OVS system container

This commit add support for building openvswitch-vswitchd and openvswitch-db-server as system container.
As part of the patch, openvswitch-vswitchd and openvswitch-db-server Dockerfile is customized to copy
special files(config.json.template manifest.json service.template tmpfiles.template) for the system container
from a github repo to /exports/ directory.

Change-Id: I6ab1550c23f609b72ad32909748850f9031541b8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/00/557300/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: {% block openvswitch_db_server_footer %} VOLUME /etc/openswitch ENV HOME /root ADD https://github.com/yogananth-subramanian/tripleo-system-container/archive/master.tar.gz /exports/ RUN cd /exports && tar --strip-components=2 -zxvf master.tar.gz tripleo-system-container-master/openvswitch-db-server/ && \ cp /exports/{ovs-run.sh,system-container-wrapper.sh} /usr/local/bin/ {% endblock %} {% block openvswitch_vswitchd_footer %} VOLUME /etc/openswitch ENV HOME /root ADD https://github.com/yogananth-subramanian/tripleo-system-container/archive/master.tar.gz /exports/ RUN cd /exports && tar --strip-components=2 -zxvf master.tar.gz tripleo-system-container-master/openvswitch-vswitchd/ && \ cp /exports/{ovs-run.sh,system-container-wrapper.sh} /usr/local/bin/ {% endblock %}

commit_message:
Modify tech-debt policy

Modify tech-debt policy to expand its definitions, the consequences it
has to the development, and why it is so important to track technical
debt.
This change propose an alternative process for technical debts
management, where all the informations are put together to allow the
community to make them informed about the effective costs of contracted
technical debts.

Change-Id: Ibcbf7dc733e7a2e63644d38df2f530590c0627c4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-specs refs/changes/92/545392/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Provide a comprehensive policy for tracking and being able to reference tech debtWhat is technical debt ---------------------- Technical Debt (TD) may be defined as the gap between perfectly developing software and the reality (ship date, skills of the engineers, tools available, working environment). In any project it may happen to decide to borrow time during the development of the current feature, and not implement some part of it for time or constraints reasons, knowing this time will have to be spent on the same implementation later by you or another person. This time is called Debt Repayment If this decision leads to also having to spend time over time to workaround the parts someone has not implemented, or manually fix problems in the system caused by this, it means that the TD is also incurring interests costs. Difference between Bugs and Technical Debts ------------------------------------------- Bugs are not TD. A bug is a lack of functionality or error that makes the product less viable for use, less efficient, or plain broken. Bugs are usually fixed or not fixed. Their urgency doesn't change often and dramatically over time. TD are usually shortcuts in implementation. They offer same level of funcionality as an optimal implementation, but determine a loss in future productivity, because of extra costs they allocate on the future in the form of increased cost of change during evolution and maintenance. A TD urgency can change dramatically over time, depending on the interest costs and frequency, and the alterations in their repayment cost. The problem with technical debts -------------------------------- It may not immediately apparent when a decision to contract a TD is really beneficial. Contracting a TD is an important decision, it allocates time for the future on your team or even a different team, and should not be taken lightly. To make an efficient decision on whether it's more convenient to contract or not TD, the possible TD must be appropriately described. After the decision of contracting a TD is made, it must be correctly tracked to eventually reevaluate the total cost, that is the repayment cost, plus the cost times frequency of the interests. If hidden, interest costs may end up clogging the backlog of feature, and bring the project to serious delays. Every unsolved TD should be taken into consideration while planning future tasks, because it may lead to unrealistic expectations on the time available to accomplish them. We need process and tools to make this decision as much informed, transparent and efficient as possible. Tracking Code Tech Debt ----------------------- When a TD is identified in an implementation, or even when the implementation is created with the TD in mind, a description of the TD must be added to a shared place, that can be easily and transparently accessed and where it can be frequently modified. This description takes the name of TD item. The initial TD item creation must contain these fields:: id: UUID, to be added as comment in the relative code as a reverse reference Description: Symptoms: Observable qualitative or measurable consequence (type of issue and analysis implications of design) Consequences: Effect on value, quality, or cost of the system in the form of accumulation; additional costs due to reduced productivity, induced defects, or loss of quality incurred by software depending on an element of technical debt Analysis: Degree to which the development approach (design consideration/limitation) meets stakeholder needs or expectations After the TD item has been added to the register, a reference must be added to the code in the form of a comment:: # TD(author): UUID During the review, all the people involved can analyse the TD and decide whether it's more convenient to contract the TD, or fix it right away and remove any trace of it from the code. Alternatively, if TD belong to a class of TD already identified, a TD class may be add instead, and a reference to that class appended to the TD item Technical Debt Evaluation +++++++++++++++++++++++++ The evaluation of a technical debt that leads to the final decision must produce and append the following informations to the TD item:: Component importance: is it worth it, will this be deprecated ? Interests Cost: Estimated cost of every interest payment Probability of occurence: Frequency estimation of interest payments Repayment Options: - Cost: Description: Once the decision of contracting the technical debt is made the following fields will have to be added to the TD item:: Repayment Type: [REPAY, CONVERT, IGNORE] Date contracted: Finder: Who identified the technical debt Borrower: Who contracted the technical debt Intentional: if the technical debt was contracted intentionally or identified after (we may have already payed interests) Status: [REPAYED, OUTSTANDING, DEPRECATED/REMOVED] After it has been contracted, there will be three ways to deal with a TD: - Ignore: The cost of the Full Repayment is much higher than the interests, the TD item will be ignored until reevaluated, and the interests will be payed for the time being. - Convert: If the cost of the Full repayment is high, but the interest represent a tangible threat, a partial fix will be put in place, that doesn't take the time of the full repayment but lowers the interests costs or frequency. - Full repayment: the TD will have to be completely fixed, contracting it now is a necessity, but the interests will cost too much to keep it for long. After the code will be merged, additional fields may be added to correctly track the evolution of the TD:: Date extinguished: History of Interests: how many times this technical debt decreased productivity - Date: Payer: Amount: Description: Stack: - list of repo/commits that use the code that holds this technical debt These fields can eventually lead to reevaluation when the impact does not match the initial estimates. Every item in the Stack field will mean that the cost of the full repayment must now include the cost of changing the code that depends on the TD. Adding an item to the stack list increases the Full Repayment cost dramatically. If the TD is planned to be repayed, it may mean that this has to be prioritized and done before the stack can be allowed to increase. Tracking Code Tech Debt with a register +++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ The TD item will be added as yaml dict inside a file file located in the root of the project called `.td-register.yaml`. Proper tooling should be implemented or existing tooling modified (reno?) to make the creation and modification of the TD register as less painful as possible for the developers. Such tool should be able to: - template all the fields - automatically add or change fields like `status` or `date` - manage uuid creation and references inside the code - create reports on the status of active TD, their interest cost payed, and future costs. Alternatives ------------ Alternatively the TD may be tracked with another tool like a bug tracking system, but full mapping of all the parts required for the TD to be tracked properly must be analyzed first (e.g. how to mark a TD as to ignore without fixing it) This approach also requires the creation of a bug in the system even if the initial evaluation decides to not include the TD in the end.++++++++++++++++++++++++++A report for a bug cannot be converted into technical debt. If the discussion on the bug leads to the creation of a technical debt, a NEW report must be filed and treated as TD item.+++++++++++++++++++No TD should be left untracked once discovered. Any TD is adding cost to the project, and contracting it cannot be done without understanding the full consequences.feel free to -2 any patches that are adding tech debt without proper analysis.Secondary author: gceramiRocky-1 * - Rocky - Enchanced tecnical debt desciption and management proposal, proposed register for the handling.
deleted_lines: Provide a basic policy for tracking and being able to reference tech debtDuring the development of TripleO, sometimes tech debt is acquired due to time or resource constraints that may exist. Without a solid way of tracking when we intentially add tech debt, it is hard to quantify how much tech debt is being self inflicted. Additionally tech debt gets lost in the code and without a way to remember where we left it, it is almost impossible to remember when and where we need to go back to fix some known issues.Tracking Code Tech Debt with Bugs ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Alternatives ------------ We continue to not track any of these things and continue to rely on developers to remember when they add code and circle back around to fix it themselves or when other developers find the issue and remove it. feel free to -1 any patches that are adding tech debt without proper attribution.Queens-1* aschultz to create tech-debt tag in Launchpad.

commit_message:
Add alternative workflow to quickstart.sh

This change adds a new workflow to quickstart.sh that takes advantage of
the existing reproducer script.
THe reproducer role will be run and a null reproducer script will be
created, the run. The reproducer will have a generic configuration and
will not run on a specific change
The new path will be activated by --generate-reproducer option.

Depends-On: Ie21f47264680b468ce51a3e1f8305670889ccb41
Depends-On: Iecb7a30d0b4d83da9b33f50ad3becf66189666be
Change-Id: If5988021d661b40c7e15c8fc6c8b41f86e8043f5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/05/548005/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: echo " --generate-reproducer" echo " do not follow standard workflow, generate a generic" echo " reproducer script instead and launch that" echo " -j, --jobtype specify the jobtpe for the generic reproducer" echo " this option implies --generate-reproducer" --generate-reproduce) NEW_WORKFLOW=1 shift ;; -j|--jobtype) TOCI_JOBTYPE=$2 NEW_WORKFLOW=1 shift ;; ### This block defines the new workflow path with reproducer script if [[ -z "$OPT_NEW_WORKFLOW" ]]; then OPT_PLAYBOOK=generate-generic-reproducer.yml print_logo activate_venv : ${TOCI_JOBTYPE:="ovb-1ctlr_1comp-featureset002"} export ANSIBLE_CONFIG=$OOOQ_DIR/ansible.cfg JOBTYPE_NODES=$(grep -o "[0-9]ctlr\(_[0-9]*[a-z]*\)*" <<< $TOCI_JOBTYPE) if [[ -z "$JOBTYPE_NODES" ]]; then # for JOBTYPE that does not contain nodes specification # e.g. the undercloud only jobs we'll just specify a # dummy NODES JOBTYPE_NODES="1ctlr" fi : ${NODES_FILE:="config/nodes/$JOBTYPE_NODES.yml"} : ${SCRIPT_TARGET_DIR:="$HOME"} export NODES_FILE export TOCI_JOBTYPE ansible-playbook -$VERBOSITY $OPT_WORKDIR/playbooks/$OPT_PLAYBOOK \ -e @$OPT_WORKDIR/config/release/$OPT_RELEASE.yml \ -e local_working_dir=$OPT_WORKDIR \ # Stop script here, prevent old workflow from running exit 0 fi

commit_message:
Extends audit serivce

Expose futher parameters as present in puppet-auditd module to allow
a more finer level of control over the audit service.

Change-Id: Ibd38c03d7ac4e1fb53c2a2fca096701b900c0156
Closes-Bug: #1668573

commit_message:
[WIP] Allow use of http_proxy

Change-Id: I4a6b72c5f2df70d55e3467e4350032574acf4d98
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/82/538982/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: install_deps_with_proxy () { sudo env http_proxy=${OPT_PROXY} yum -y install \ /usr/bin/git \ /usr/bin/virtualenv \ gcc \ libyaml \ libselinux-python \ libffi-devel \ openssl-devel \ redhat-rpm-config } echo " -P --proxy <http_proxy>" echo " use http proxy (provide full url with AUTH if needed:" echo " -P http://user:password@your_proxy:8080" --proxy|-P) OPT_PROXY+=("$2") shift ;;if [ -n "$OPT_PROXY" ]; then export {http,https,ftp}_proxy=${OPT_PROXY} fi if [ -n "$OPT_PROXY" ]; then echo "NOTICE: installing dependencies" install_deps_with_proxy exit $? else echo "NOTICE: installing dependencies" install_deps exit $? fi

commit_message:
Featureset 22: run tempest (smoke+basic)

This commit will enable running tempest with a minimal/basic test
regex.  This is the same configuration that is run in rdophase2.
We should catch basic tempest smoke issues as part of tripleo promotion
not further down the production pipeline.

Change-Id: I704007e482e632297b93cb416e528abc722d39c6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/08/529408/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # run tempest, smoke + basic tests. This is the same config used in rdophase2 tempest_config: true run_tempest: true tempest_workers: 4 test_regex: smoke|test_minimum_basic|test_network_basic_ops|test_snapshot_pattern|test_volume_boot_pattern

commit_message:
Add openstack undercloud restore

This new option allow to restore an Undercloud
backup.

If you want to try this new openstack undercloud option
in your dev env:

1- Copy the content of undercloud.py to:
/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/tripleoclient/v1/undercloud.py

2- Register the plugin in the entry points:
  Update: /usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/python_tripleoclient-7.0xxx.devxxx-py2.7.egg-info/entry_points.txt
  Appending: undercloud_restore = tripleoclient.v1.undercloud:RestoreUndercloud      at the end of the file

You should be able to test the CLI then.

Change-Id: I0aa1086dc804fd03631e4bd4823e8613d58f9cc9
Related bp undercloud-backup-restore

added_lines: import shutilclass RestoreUndercloud(command.Command): """Upgrade undercloud""" auth_required = False log = logging.getLogger(__name__ + ".UpgradeUndercloud") def get_parser(self, prog_name): parser = argparse.ArgumentParser( description=self.get_description(), prog=prog_name, add_help=False ) parser.add_argument( '--backup-path', action='store', required= True, help=_('Set the restore backup path.') ) return parser def take_action(self, parsed_args): self.log.debug("take action(%s)" % parsed_args) utils.ensure_run_as_normal_user() # Move this to instack-undecloud if (os.path.isfile(parsed_args.backup_path)): folder = os.path.dirname(parsed_args.backup_path) output_folder = os.path.join(folder, 'extracted') output_db = os.path.join(output_folder, 'home/stack/undercloud-all-databases.sql') output_repos = os.path.join(output_folder, 'etc/yum.repos.d/') if not os.path.exists(output_folder): os.makedirs(output_folder) subprocess.check_call(['sudo', 'systemctl', 'stop', 'openstack-*']) subprocess.check_call(['sudo', 'systemctl', 'stop', 'neutron-*']) subprocess.check_call(['sudo', 'systemctl', 'stop', 'httpd']) subprocess.check_call(['tar', '-jxf', parsed_args.backup_path, '-C', output_folder]) proc = subprocess.Popen(['mysql', '-u', 'root'], stdin=subprocess.PIPE, stdout=subprocess.PIPE) out, err = proc.communicate(file(output_db.encode("utf-8")).read()) repo_files = os.listdir(output_repos.encode("utf-8")) for rfile in repo_files: if ('delorean' in rfile): shutil.move(os.path.join(output_repos.encode("utf-8"),rfile), os.path.join('/etc/yum.repos.d/',rfile)) #subprocess.check_call(['sudo', 'yum', '-y', 'update', # 'instack-undercloud', # 'openstack-puppet-modules', # 'openstack-tripleo-common', # 'python-tripleoclient']) subprocess.check_call(['openstack', 'undercloud', 'install']) else: self.log.debug("Backup file not found") msg = ('Unable to restore the Undercloud backup. ' 'File %s does not exists' % (parsed_args.backup_path)) raise OSError('5', msg)

Enable ipmi_devintf kernel module

To allow ipmitool to locate the IPMI device ipmi_devintf
kernel module has to be loaded.

commit_message:
Add interactive prompt to recreate venv in case last run failed

The --clean option is problematic to default. I personally always
run with --clean, but we decided it was wrong to default to
deleting files from a user's home directory. This could be even
worse if a user set the working directory to something like "/"
by accident somehow.

However, if we do not clean the virtualenv we are not actually
including any new changes to the playbooks, roles or configs, since
they will not overwrite what we have from the previous runs.

In some cases, this can lead to quickstart failing, and all
subsequent runs will also fail for the same issue. That is a pretty
awful user experience if one is unfamiliar with the --clean option.

Instead, we can drop a dot file in the working dir to indicate the
run failed, so on the following run we can prompt the user to try
to recreate the virtualenv.

Change-Id: Iff29525a7558fd7991f60a6f2c044ece97e3aad8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/79/467679/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: trap "exit_val=\$?; [ \$exit_val != 0 ] && touch \$OPT_WORKDIR/.failed;" EXIT if [ "$OPT_CLEAN" = 0 ] && [ -f "$OPT_WORKDIR/.failed" ]; then # prompt to clean venv since last run failed echo "The last run of quickstart.sh failed, but we kept the working\ directory." | sed -e 's/[[:space:]][[:space:]]*/ /g' echo "Would you like to delete $OPT_WORKDIR and recreate it [Y/n]?" read RECREATE_VENV if [ "$RECREATE_VENV" != "n" ]; then clean_virtualenv else # if we dont want to clean the venv remove the .failed file # it will get recreated if the current run fails rm -f $OPT_WORKDIR/.failed fi fi

Adds environment file for OVS Hardware Offload using env generator

Change-Id: I8d9c4ef7e7b88bf70b5f1dc02c1d69a78e5206f7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/23/532123/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # ******************************************************************* # This file was created automatically by the sample environment # generator. Developers should use `tox -e genconfig` to update it. # Users are recommended to make changes to a copy of the file instead # of the original, if any customizations are needed. # ******************************************************************* # title: Enable the Neutron OVS with Hardware Offload # description: | # A Heat environment that can be used to deploy Neutron OVS with Hardware Offload parameter_defaults: # ****************************************************** # Static parameters - these are values that must be # included in the environment but should not be changed. # ****************************************************** # List of scheduler available filters # Type: comma_delimited_list NovaSchedulerAvailableFilters: ['nova.scheduler.filters.all_filters', 'nova.scheduler.filters.pci_passthrough_filter.PciPassthroughFilter'] # An array of filters used by Nova to filter a node.These filters will be applied in the order they are listed, so place your most restrictive filters first to make the filtering process more efficient. # Type: comma_delimited_list NovaSchedulerDefaultFilters: ['RetryFilter', 'AvailabilityZoneFilter', 'RamFilter', 'ComputeFilter', 'ComputeCapabilitiesFilter', 'ImagePropertiesFilter', 'ServerGroupAntiAffinityFilter', 'ServerGroupAffinityFilter', 'PciPassthroughFilter'] # ********************* # End static parameters # ********************* ComputeSriovParameters: # Provide the list of VFs to be reserved for each SR-IOV interface. # Format "[<interface_name1>:<numvfs1>:<mode>,<interface_name2>:<numvfs2>]" # Example "[eth1:4096:switchdev,eth2:128:legacy,eth3:30]" # Type: comma_delimited_list NeutronSriovNumVFs: '' # List of PCI Passthrough whitelist parameters. Example - NovaPCIPassthrough: # - vendor_id: "8086" # product_id: "154c" # address: "0000:05:00.0" # physical_network: "datacentre" # For different formats, refer to the nova.conf documentation for pci_passthrough_whitelist configuration # Type: json NovaPCIPassthrough: '' # ****************************************************** # Static parameters - these are values that must be # included in the environment but should not be changed. # ****************************************************** # Kernel Args to apply to the host # Type: string KernelArgs: intel_iommu=on iommu=pt # Enable OVS Hardware Offload. This feature supported from OVS 2.8.0 # Type: boolean # ********************* # End static parameters # ********************* resource_registry: OS::TripleO::Services::NeutronSriovHostConfig: ../puppet/services/neutron-sriov-host-config.yam
deleted_lines: # A Heat environment file that enables OVS Hardware Offload in the overcloud. # This works by configuring SR-IOV NIC with switchdev and OVS Hardware Offload on # compute nodes. The feature supported in OVS 2.8.0 resource_registry: OS::TripleO::Services::NeutronSriovHostConfig: ../puppet/services/neutron-sriov-host-config.yaml parameter_defaults: NovaSchedulerDefaultFilters: ['RetryFilter','AvailabilityZoneFilter','RamFilter','ComputeFilter','ComputeCapabilitiesFilter','ImagePropertiesFilter','ServerGroupAntiAffinityFilter','ServerGroupAffinityFilter','PciPassthroughFilter'] NovaSchedulerAvailableFilters: ["nova.scheduler.filters.all_filters","nova.scheduler.filters.pci_passthrough_filter.PciPassthroughFilter"] # Kernel arguments for ComputeSriov node ComputeSriovParameters: KernelArgs: "intel_iommu=on iommu=pt" # Number of VFs that needs to be configured for a physical interface #NeutronSriovNumVFs: ["ens3f0:4:switchdev"] # Mapping of SR-IOV PF interface to neutron physical_network. # In case of Vxlan/GRE physical_network should be null. # In case of flat/vlan the physical_network should as configured in neutron. #NovaPCIPassthrough: # - devname: "ens3f0" # physical_network: null

Adds environment file for ODL OVS Hardware Offload using env generator

Change-Id: Ic0a1f18322149d33afe80235d3b6d01418513235
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/49/532149/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # ******************************************************************* # This file was created automatically by the sample environment # generator. Developers should use `tox -e genconfig` to update it. # Users are recommended to make changes to a copy of the file instead # of the original, if any customizations are needed. # ******************************************************************* # title: Enable the Neutron ODL OVS with Hardware Offload # description: | # A Heat environment that can be used to deploy Neutron ODL OVS with Hardware Offload parameter_defaults: # ****************************************************** # Static parameters - these are values that must be # included in the environment but should not be changed. # ****************************************************** # If True, DHCP always provides metadata route to VM. # Type: boolean NeutronEnableForceMetadata: True # The mechanism drivers for the Neutron tenant network. # Type: comma_delimited_list NeutronMechanismDrivers: ['opendaylight_v2'] # Comma-separated list of extensions enabled for the Neutron plugin. # Type: comma_delimited_list NeutronPluginExtensions: ['port_security'] # Comma-separated list of service plugin entrypoints to be loaded from the # neutron.service_plugins namespace. # Type: comma_delimited_list NeutronServicePlugins: ['odl-router_v2','trunk'] # List of scheduler available filters # Type: comma_delimited_list NovaSchedulerAvailableFilters: ['nova.scheduler.filters.all_filters', 'nova.scheduler.filters.pci_passthrough_filter.PciPassthroughFilter'] # An array of filters used by Nova to filter a node.These filters will be applied in the order they are listed, so place your most restrictive filters first to make the filtering process more efficient. # Type: comma_delimited_list NovaSchedulerDefaultFilters: ['RetryFilter', 'AvailabilityZoneFilter', 'RamFilter', 'ComputeFilter', 'ComputeCapabilitiesFilter', 'ImagePropertiesFilter', 'ServerGroupAntiAffinityFilter', 'ServerGroupAffinityFilter', 'PciPassthroughFilter'] # ********************* # End static parameters # ********************* ComputeSriovParameters: # Kernel Args to apply to the host # Type: string KernelArgs: intel_iommu=on iommu=pt # Provide the list of VFs to be reserved for each SR-IOV interface. Format "<interface_name1>:<numvfs1>,<interface_name2>:<numvfs2>" Example "eth1:4096,eth2:128" # Type: comma_delimited_list NeutronSriovNumVFs: '' # List of PCI Passthrough whitelist parameters. Example - NovaPCIPassthrough: # - vendor_id: "8086" # product_id: "154c" # address: "0000:05:00.0" # physical_network: "datacentre" # For different formats, refer to the nova.conf documentation for pci_passthrough_whitelist configuration # Type: json NovaPCIPassthrough: '' # Enable OVS Hardware Offload. This feature supported from OVS 2.8.0 # Type: boolean OvsHwOffload: True resource_registry: OS::TripleO::Services::ComputeNeutronOvsAgent: OS::Heat::None OS::TripleO::Services::NeutronL3Agent: OS::Heat::None OS::TripleO::Services::NeutronOvsAgent: OS::Heat::None OS::TripleO::Services::NeutronSriovHostConfig: ../puppet/services/neutron-sriov-host-config.yaml

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-30 08:08:08.000000000', 'files': ['tripleo_common/tests/utils/test_nodes.py', 'releasenotes/notes/ilo-port-support-for-pxe-ilo-driver-41498596f1290d0c.yaml', 'tripleo_common/tests/actions/test_baremetal.py', 'tripleo_common/utils/nodes.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common/commit/b9fb962f142b99856ab474fe9c26e2ccc43885b4', 'message': "Adds support to configure 'ilo_port' for 'pxe_ilo' driver

Using Tripleo, one cannot not create a node with 'ilo_port' in
node's driver_info when 'pxe_ilo' driver is used.
Ironic driver 'pxe_ilo' driver supports configuring non-default
port to connect to iLO using 'ilo_port' as a node's driver_info

Closes-Bug: #1713911

commit_message:
Adds support to configure 'ilo_port' for 'pxe_ilo' driver

Using Tripleo, one cannot not create a node with 'ilo_port' in
node's driver_info when 'pxe_ilo' driver is used.
Ironic driver 'pxe_ilo' driver supports configuring non-default
port to connect to iLO using 'ilo_port' as a node's driver_info
property. This commit adds that support.

Change-Id: I579d7fbce59cbe4af5f033d0a12095d4d2177c3b
Closes-Bug: #1713911
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/75/499075/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: '.*_ilo': PrefixedDriverInfo('ilo', has_port=True),

commit_message:
[WIP] Add networks directory

This patch creates networks directory to hold networks definitions. This is initial
step in getting the networks operated the same way as Roles.

Change-Id: I79940d46192fc73847684eb27dff05812f9ef5d5

commit_message:
Add job to test password changes

Depends-On: Ibcb3a41b040953aeea3001cccddef0290ad5df7c

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/88/567888/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Deploy minimal overcloud (keystone and supporting services) and run # a minor version update (overcloud only). composable_scenario: scenario000-multinode-containers.yaml # tripleo-upgrade role variables redeploy_noop: true overcloud_generate_passwords: true overcloud_password_list: - NovaPassword - BarbicanPassword - CinderPassword # NOTE: right now the container images stay the same before and # after update. This makes the job run fast while still testing # the update workflow itself. For the future we may consider # updating the container images too. (This might have to be paired # with some work on the image building side to get meaningful # from-to combination of images. container_registry_file: containers-default-parameters.yaml tripleo_upgrade_validations_non_fatal: true tripleo_upgrade_debug: true tripleo_ci: true use_oooq: true overcloud_ssh_user: "tripleo-admin" network_isolation: false enable_pacemaker: false overcloud_ipv6: false containerized_overcloud: true undercloud_generate_service_certificate: false ssl_overcloud: false run_tripleo_validations: false run_tripleo_validations_negative_tests: false exit_on_validations_failure: false # extra testing disabled for now, may be enabled later depending on # job run time test_ping: false run_tempest: false # test_white_regex: 'tempest.scenario.test_network_basic_ops.TestNetworkBasicOps.test_network_basic_ops' composable_roles: true overcloud_roles: - name: Controller CountDefault: 1 tags: - primary - controller networks: - External - InternalApi - Storage - StorageMgmt - Tenant deploy_steps_ansible_workflow: true config_download_args: >- {% if release not in ['newton','ocata','pike'] -%} -e /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates/environments/config-download-environment.yaml -e {{ working_dir }}/config-download.yaml --config-download --deployed-server --disable-validations --verbose {%- endif -%}

commit_message:
FFU: Remove all the old elements files

If some element file is not provided by deployment steps or rpm
than it's bug but not FFU one. We instead need to make sure old
elements are _really_ gone.

Change-Id: I93142ebc9564bb2cad0612069d58605a10c00b9e
Resolves: rhbz#1574258 rhbz#1561255

commit_message:
Revert "Revert "Switch public endpoints to use FQDNs by default""

This reverts commit f254a2169dcdf74590bab90ef66b47ba69fdef87.

Change-Id: Ie57040644f2ccf5e5e7adfa058f7722e54c88421
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/63/569363/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - | CloudName is now a required parameter. Given that FQDNs are now the default instead of IP addresses, to avoid people using the localdomain (which used to be the default for domain for CloudName), we now remove the default, and require folks to set their own. - | The overcloud endpoints now point to FQDNs instead of IP addresses. This was done as part of the public TLS by default work, and is needed since the certificates have FQDNs for SubjectAltNames.

commit_message:
Revert "Revert "Change default endpoint map entries to use TLS""

This reverts commit d5b34858de524fbb56e674c1be6b2fd36167204f.

It also sets EnablePublicTLS as part of the default resource registry.
This way that value can be read by tripleo-common.

Depends-On: Ie50ca1ade3894d48f8d682a59a088d1a0fc8527c
Change-Id: I339a9af0a655e14f669dee8d382630844e9bc66f

commit_message:
TLS by default for the overcloud for VIPs and FQDNs

This gets a TLS certificate for the overcloud when necessary:

* If no incoming cert/key is provided and we don't expect the
  overcloud's certmonger instances to request the certificates,
  we request one to the undercloud's certmonger local CA.

* If a certificate was provided, we verify if it's user-provided
  or if it was autogenerated.

  - If it was user-provided we pass through that certificate

  - If it was autogenerated, we request or resubmit the request
    if it's needed.

* We also accept the EnableTLS flag, which the deployer can
  explicitly turn off if they decide not to use TLS.

* As an addition, it will add both the FQDN and the IP in the
  SAN of the certificate.

Change-Id: Ie50ca1ade3894d48f8d682a59a088d1a0fc8527c

commit_message:
Add OS_USERNAME and OS_PROJECT_NAME to PS1

This patch adds OS_USERNAME and OS_PROJECT_NAME to the PS1 of the
command prompt. The should help reduce confusion about which user
and project is being used to interact with the openstack.

Change-Id: I58269cc00a3c66199acba3c432e9844ad83d3832
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/77/532577/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - | Adds OS_USERNAME and OS_PROJECT_NAME to PS1 of the command prompt

Ceph jewel creates the client.bootstrap-osd auth entry when the cluster
is created. heat does not need to pass this key to ceph::key as the
auth will already be populated on the monitors and the OSD nodes will
extract a copy from memory. This patch removes client.bootstrap-osd from
the ceph::profile::params::client_keys array.

Change-Id: Ia9c50afd3a88b27e6e0dca2ce150f91633681466
Partial-bug: 1769722
Depends-on: I11f134bed59da706a03ce4a70d941145c16f8175
'}]
commit_message:
Unnessary deploying of bootstrap-osd ceph auth entry

Ceph jewel creates the client.bootstrap-osd auth entry when the cluster
is created. heat does not need to pass this key to ceph::key as the
auth will already be populated on the monitors and the OSD nodes will
extract a copy from memory. This patch removes client.bootstrap-osd from
the ceph::profile::params::client_keys array.

Change-Id: Ia9c50afd3a88b27e6e0dca2ce150f91633681466
Partial-bug: 1769722
Depends-on: I11f134bed59da706a03ce4a70d941145c16f8175

commit_message:
Keep plan-environment only on upgrade

To avoid passing all the deploy options (nodes count, flavor
ntp & so on ..) we need to keep *only* the plan-environment file
for update/upgrade and FFU.

Change-Id: Ia34cbf36b240f540841822fddd8d9d192c48493f

commit_message:
Set FixedIp by default for public-facing VIP

For new deployments, this sets the *FixedIPs parameter in order to get a
predictable VIP. We'll then use this predictable VIP to set it as a SAN
for the TLS certificate in order to have TLS by default.

For the case where we'ere using network-isolation, we look for the
external network. If we're not using network isolation, we use the
ctlplane network. For both cases, we base IP on the allocation range,
also taking into account if there are already IPs allocated in that
range (which is usually the case for the ctlplane network).

Co-Authored-By: Cédric Jeanneret <cjeanner@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I40ce7d88897c6eb6c6cae95d377d72b3a7249772
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/18/569818/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: skip_deploy_identifier=False, current_networks=[]): self.current_networks = current_networks using_netiso = self.is_using_network_isolation(env, self.current_networks) self.set_fixed_ip_parameters(parameters, env, self.current_networks, using_network_isolation) def is_using_network_isolation(self, env, current_networks): relevant_network_entry = self._get_relevant_network_entry( env, current_networks) if not relevant_network_entry: return False vip_resource_name = \ 'OS::TripleO::Network::Ports::{network_name}VipPort'.format( network_name=relevant_network_entry.name) vip_entry = env['resource_registry'].get(vip_resource_name) if not vip_entry: return False return vip_entry != 'OS::Heat::None' def _get_relevant_network_entry(self, env, current_networks): if not current_networks: return None return filtered_networks[0] def set_fixed_ip_parameters(self, parameters, env, using_netiso): if using_netiso: fixed_ip_key = 'PublicVirtualFixedIPs' else: fixed_ip_key = 'ControlFixedIps' if not self._fixed_ip_parameter_set(env, fixed_ip_key): # Here is where we set either the control plane VIP or the public # VIP.... not how to to set the control plane one though... def _fixed_ip_parameter_set(self, env, fixed_ip_key): return env['parameter_defaults'].get(fixed_ip_key) != None

commit_message:
[WIP] Update tripleo-inventory for extra nodes on OVB

Supplemental nodes may not be either provisioned via the libvirt/setup
role (virt) or through OVB by way of the 'extra' node deployment(cite).

This patch updates the tripleo-inventory role to allow for the OVB
workflow.

Change-Id: I04175b216f38082074d4de1e0c1a4c3177b3e7ec
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/46/541446/17 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # For OVB jobs, we must pull the extra node IP for the supplemental node # FIXME(hrybacki): find actual 'switch' used to determine OVB jobs - when: undercloud_type == 'ovb' - name: copy get-overcloud-nodes.py to undercloud template: src: 'get-extra-node-ip.py.j2' dest: '{{ working_dir }}/get-extra-node-ip.py' mode: 0755 - name: fetch extra node IP shell: > python {{ working_dir }}/get-extra-node-ip.py register: extra_node_ip - name: set the supplemental_node_ip set_fact: supplemental_node_ip: "{{ extra_node_ip.stdout }}"
