commit_message:
libvirt-reproducer: use ansible_connection=local

Presently the user's own key needs to be added to authorized_users.

Since the --libvirt option is for localhost only, use the
'local' connection plugin.  This removes a common first point
of frustration for users and will avoid ssh entirely for the virthost
connection

Closes-Bug: #1769530
Change-Id: I7cafe0e4315cc6877e0e50ebfcc8e0f8307582d1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras refs/changes/49/566149/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: export VIRTHOST="localhost ansible_connection=local"

commit_message:
Build all image filesystems with a 4k sector size

This will support both 512b and native 4k disks.

The overcloud-full images were altered in
I1e64647b3de86bc87a2a04cedf54ac83bbd4963d, but the non-default images were not.

Change-Id: I5f4566a53974ebbfc58a6709616c3ce7f7dd261f
Closes-Bug: #1746727

commit_message:
DMN: Testing tripleo-ci upgrade logic (sprint 14) (change2)

This is a no-op change to THT (master branch) used to create
a new THT rpm that needs to be injected during the upgrade/update
workflow

It depends on another change (also master, THT) to validate
the case where we have multiple patches on the same branch

This patch depends on:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/572933 (tht, master)
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/572736 (tqe)

Change-Id: I75b5481c5279c6e7c4017a184c8a21fe252a000a
Depends-On: I5abb4c202e86dabd57e9e5d412d23720d7f6e550
Context: https://trello.com/c/6tcD7ilr/778-injecting-zuul-changes-at-various-points-in-the-job-workflow

added_lines: #!/bin/env python import sys import csv def read_csv(csv_file): return set(tuple(row) for row in csv.reader(open(csv_file))) if __name__ == '__main__': previous_csv = read_csv(sys.argv[1]) current_csv = read_csv(sys.argv[2]) current_diff = current_csv - previous_csv previous_diff = previous_csv - current_csv pair = zip(sorted(previous_diff), sorted(current_diff)) for previous, current in pair: # TODO Retrieve the commiters info print("p: " + str(previous)) print("c: " + str(current))

subject: Limit curl operation to pull/push Swift rings to 120 seconds
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-13 07:10:04.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/profile/base/swift/ringbuilder.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo/commit/22250d59607721c602facfd94718145d1c4f343e', 'message': "Limit curl operation to pull/push Swift rings to 120 seconds

This will limit the overall time for curl to 120 seconds. This should be
more than enough time for curl to push/pull rings (which are typically
less than a MiB in size on OOO). If this is not done within 120 seconds,
something is not working as expected and we don't want to block this for
much longer.

Related-Bug: 1776550
Change-Id: I171955069c5ad53979b60912a67ccd61ae0acf93
"}]
commit_message:
Limit curl operation to pull/push Swift rings to 120 seconds

This will limit the overall time for curl to 120 seconds. This should be
more than enough time for curl to push/pull rings (which are typically
less than a MiB in size on OOO). If this is not done within 120 seconds,
something is not working as expected and we don't want to block this for
much longer.

Related-Bug: 1776550
Change-Id: I171955069c5ad53979b60912a67ccd61ae0acf93

commit_message:
Add workflow to set dns entries in FreeIPA

We need to set the overcloud node DNS entries in IPA.
This workflow and ansible playbook does that.

Partially resolves BZ 1534070

Depends-On: Ieeb5aac0c70dd1b87b27379cd61cc52d9767c508
Change-Id: I56e66fbca14cf1c63ad0410037df8cac251f5d09
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/60/552660/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- - name: Add DNS records hosts: localhost connection: local gather_facts: False tasks: - set_fact: dnsdict: [] cred_cache: /tmp/dnscreds-{{ansible_date_time.epoch}}.cache - name: get entry dict set_fact: dnsdict: "{{ dnsdict + [{'ip': item.split()[0], 'short': item.split()[1].split('.')[0], 'zone': item.split()[1]|regex_replace('^[^.]*\\.')}] }}" with_items: "{{host_entries}}" - name: do kinit shell: | kinit -kt {{keytab}} -c {{cred_cache}} dnsadmin/`hostname` - name: add records shell: | ipa dnszone-find {{item.zone}}. if [ ! $? -eq 0 ]; then ipa dnszone-add {{item.zone}}. fi ipa dnsrecord-find {{item.zone}} {{item.short}} if [ ! $? -eq 0 ]; then if [[ {{ item.ip }} =~ .*:.* ]]; then rec_type='--aaaa-ip-address' else rec_type='--a-ip-address' fi ipa dnsrecord-add {{item.zone}} {{item.short}} $rec_type={{item.ip}} fi with_items: "{{dnsdict}}" environment: KRB5_KTNAME: "{{keytab}}" KRB5CCNAME: "{{cred_cache}}"

commit_message:
Add some Database and Messaging standalone example role definitions

Extend the number of possible architectures which are included in roles
directory with composable roles of standalone Database or Messaging role
and based on which roles_data.yaml file with standalone only Database
or Messaging (or both) roles could be generated by using "openstack
overcloud roles generate" command.

Change-Id: I3c08f3f5bb972e39faf77ce1f89c1a034be080e6

commit_message:
Pass overcloud_admin to the deployed_srv admin creation

The workflow for creating the deployed server admin user
takes in param the overcloud_admin, which is set by default
to tripleo-admin.
This patch add to the scrip the possibility to change the
default value for the overcloud_admin user.

Change-Id: Ia776a27ef4f806240e3cdb1620f080d4331aac09
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/04/572204/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: OVERCLOUD_ADMIN_USER=${OVERCLOUD_ADMIN_USER:-"tripleo-admin"}echo "SSH user: $OVERCLOUD_ADMIN_USER"EXECUTION_PARAMS="{\"overcloud_admin\": \"$OVERCLOUD_ADMIN_USER\", \"ssh_user\": \"$OVERCLOUD_SSH_USER\", \"ssh_servers\": $(overcloud_ssh_hosts_json), \"ssh_private_key\": $(overcloud_ssh_key_json "$SHORT_TERM_KEY_PRIVATE")}"

commit_message:
Add overcloud-admin-user option to the cli

This patch allow the user to specify the overcloud-admin-user
for the deployed server deployment.
It avoid to keep the hardcoded tripleo-admin one.

Change-Id: I6159fca392413159dc4d96e633d4b837f6ca861e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/10/573310/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: parser.add_argument( '--overcloud-admin-user', action='store', default='tripleo-admin', help=_('Account to use for the administrator role of the ' 'Overcloud nodes.' 'If the account does not exist on the system it will be ' 'created, otherwise, the TripleO ssh key will be added ' 'to the ~/.ssh/authorized_keys of the user.' 'This option is available for the Deployed server ' 'deployment.') ) parsed_arg.overcloud_admin_user,

commit_message:
Add TRIPLEO_CI_ROOT variable

This change simplify the location of the tripleo-ci project by using
a single variable based on the toci_gate script location. This makes
it easier to run the script from a ci-defined location of the tripleo-ci
checkout.

Change-Id: I66859dbb2b8c9cbd438b61561ac50cb24f5cde92
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/22/574122/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: TRIPLEO_CI_ROOT=$(dirname $0) source ${TRIPLEO_CI_ROOT}/scripts/common_vars.bash source ${TRIPLEO_CI_ROOT}/scripts/common_functions.sh exec ${TRIPLEO_CI_ROOT}/toci_gate_test-orig.shsource ${TRIPLEO_CI_ROOT}/scripts/oooq_common_functions.sh source ${TRIPLEO_CI_ROOT}/scripts/$RHCLOUD.envcat ${TRIPLEO_CI_ROOT}/scripts/fake_fail_subunit | gzip - > $WORKSPACE/logs/testrepository.subunit.gzexport COLLECT_CONF="${TRIPLEO_CI_ROOT}/toci-quickstart/config/collect-logs.yml"export RELEASES_SCRIPT=${TRIPLEO_CI_ROOT}/scripts/emit_releases_file/emit_releases_file.py ENV_VARS="$ENV_VARS --extra-vars @${TRIPLEO_CI_ROOT}/toci-quickstart/config/testenv/ovb.yml" if [[ -f "${TRIPLEO_CI_ROOT}/toci-quickstart/config/testenv/ovb-$RHCLOUD.yml" ]]; then ENV_VARS="$ENV_VARS --extra-vars @${TRIPLEO_CI_ROOT}/toci-quickstart/config/testenv/ovb-$RHCLOUD.yml" ENV_VARS="$ENV_VARS --extra-vars @${TRIPLEO_CI_ROOT}/toci-quickstart/config/testenv/multinode-rdocloud.yml" ENV_VARS="$ENV_VARS --extra-vars @${TRIPLEO_CI_ROOT}/toci-quickstart/config/testenv/multinode.yml" ENV_VARS="$ENV_VARS --extra-vars @${TRIPLEO_CI_ROOT}/toci-quickstart/config/testenv/multinode-rdocloud.yml" ENV_VARS="$ENV_VARS --extra-vars @${TRIPLEO_CI_ROOT}/toci-quickstart/config/testenv/multinode.yml"pushd ${TRIPLEO_CI_ROOT} ${TRIPLEO_CI_ROOT}/scripts/tripleo.sh \
deleted_lines: source $(dirname $0)/scripts/common_vars.bash source $(dirname $0)/scripts/common_functions.sh exec $TRIPLEO_ROOT/tripleo-ci/toci_gate_test-orig.shsource $TRIPLEO_ROOT/tripleo-ci/scripts/oooq_common_functions.sh source $(dirname $0)/scripts/$RHCLOUD.envcat $TRIPLEO_ROOT/tripleo-ci/scripts/fake_fail_subunit | gzip - > $WORKSPACE/logs/testrepository.subunit.gzexport COLLECT_CONF="$TRIPLEO_ROOT/tripleo-ci/toci-quickstart/config/collect-logs.yml"export RELEASES_SCRIPT=$TRIPLEO_ROOT/tripleo-ci/scripts/emit_releases_file/emit_releases_file.py ENV_VARS="$ENV_VARS --extra-vars @$TRIPLEO_ROOT/tripleo-ci/toci-quickstart/config/testenv/ovb.yml" if [[ -f "$TRIPLEO_ROOT/tripleo-ci/toci-quickstart/config/testenv/ovb-$RHCLOUD.yml" ]]; then ENV_VARS="$ENV_VARS --extra-vars @$TRIPLEO_ROOT/tripleo-ci/toci-quickstart/config/testenv/ovb-$RHCLOUD.yml" ENV_VARS="$ENV_VARS --extra-vars @$TRIPLEO_ROOT/tripleo-ci/toci-quickstart/config/testenv/multinode-rdocloud.yml" ENV_VARS="$ENV_VARS --extra-vars @$TRIPLEO_ROOT/tripleo-ci/toci-quickstart/config/testenv/multinode.yml" ENV_VARS="$ENV_VARS --extra-vars @$TRIPLEO_ROOT/tripleo-ci/toci-quickstart/config/testenv/multinode-rdocloud.yml" ENV_VARS="$ENV_VARS --extra-vars @$TRIPLEO_ROOT/tripleo-ci/toci-quickstart/config/testenv/multinode.yml"pushd $TRIPLEO_ROOT/tripleo-ci $TRIPLEO_ROOT/tripleo-ci/scripts/tripleo.sh \

commit_message:
Rename repos variable to nodepool_repos

'repos' is used by other roles, so overriding it is more complex than
it needs to be.

Change-Id: I18d96da0a1184388ac6624a0d7c47de3d0a2bd98

added_lines: nodepool_repos:

commit_message:
Add release to gating repo

Now that we are going to run build-test-packages and install-build-repo
in the install and upgrade steps, we nee to disable in the upgrade
step the previous gating repo, to do se this patch add the release
to all the places need to disable it and also for debug purposes.

Change-Id: I9f5d78a719e4c127ba33e8bc99a92669fef2f108
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras refs/changes/36/572736/20 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Get stats from previous gating repo stat: path={{ artg_compressed_gating_repo }} register: previous_gating_repo_stats - name: Archive previous gating repo block: - name: Copy the gating repo copy: src: '{{ artg_compressed_gating_repo }}' dest: '{{ build_repo_dir }}/previous_gating_repo.tar.gz' - name: Remove previous gating repo file: path: '{{ build_repo_dir }}/previous_gating_repo.tar.gz' state: absent when: previous_gating_repo_stats.stat.exists

subject: Add Ansible playbook & Mistral workflow for Swift to update ring devices
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-12-21 21:34:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common/commit/66ff1c09e23c1f3c6058902f989bc0cc7001e5de', 'message': 'Update Ansible playbook for Swift to add all missing devices to rings

This playbook uses the Ansible inventory to add all unused disks to the
Swift rings. Devices are only used if they are not mounted yet.

This update has some very useful improvements compared to the old
deployment method:

- Uses available disks on storage nodes automatically. No more manually
  definition of SwiftRawDisks needed
- The actual device size is used to determine the device weight, thus
  storage nodes are balanced much better if they use differently sized
  disks
- Operators can use storage nodes with different numbers of disks.
  Before this, the numbers had to be identical and disks had to be
  defined manually
- SSDs are preferred for account and container rings, resulting in a
  better performance
- Partition power is calculated based on the actual number of available
  devices

The root disk ("d1" devices) is only used if there are less disks than
replicas.

So far this playbook only adds missing devices and does not update
existing ones.

Change-Id: Ifeb33e42438e2e5297dd620b1253e0fc8096207e

commit_message:
Add Ansible playbook & Mistral workflow for Swift to update ring devices

This update has some useful improvements compared to the old
deployment method:

- Operators can use storage nodes with different numbers of disks.
  Before this, the numbers had to be identical and disks had to be
  defined manually
- Partition power is calculated based on the actual number of available
  devices

The root disk ("d1" devices) is only used if there are less disks than
replicas.

So far this playbook only adds missing devices and does not update
existing ones.

Change-Id: Ifeb33e42438e2e5297dd620b1253e0fc8096207e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/08/529708/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: replicas: 3 obj_port: 6000 cont_port: 6001 acc_port: 6002 # One can manually override this and use Ansible extravars to specify # the complete disk layout manually - name: Get unused disks from storage nodes get_swift_disks: inventory: "{{ hostvars }}" register: disks when: disks is not defined # The legacy d1 devices - name: Add local only d1 devices if no disks available set_fact: disks: "{'devices': {{ disks.devices|default([]) }} + [{'storage_ip': '{{hostvars[item].storage_mgmt_ip}}', 'device': 'd1', 'rotational': 1, 'size': 1, 'host': '{{item}}' }]}" with_items: "{{ groups.swift_storage }}" when: disks.devices | length == 0 # Replicas are 1..3 by default, depending on the number of available # disks. Part power should be enough for a 100x growth, but not too big - name: Compute replicas, partition power and disk distribution for new rings set_fact: replicas: "{{ [disks.devices | length, replicas] | min}}" partpower: "{{ ([disks.devices | length, 1] | max * 100 * 100 * replicas) | log | int }}" ssds: "{{ disks.devices | selectattr('rotational', 'equalto', '0') | list }}" non_ssds: "{{ disks.devices | selectattr('rotational', 'equalto', '1') | list }}" # If there are more SSDs than replicas, use SSDs for # account/containers, and disks for objects - name: Assign SSDs to account and container rings if available set_fact: acc_cont_devices: "{{ ssds if ssds|length >= replicas else disks.devices }}" obj_devices: "{{ non_ssds if ssds|length >= replicas else disks.devices }}" - name: Check if object.builder exists stat: path: /tmp/swift-rings/etc/swift/object.builder register: obj_builder - name: Create new object ring if required command: swift-ring-builder /tmp/swift-rings/etc/swift/object.builder create {{partpower}} {{replicas}} 1 when: obj_builder.stat.exists == False - name: Check if container.builder exists stat: path: /tmp/swift-rings/etc/swift/container.builder register: cont_builder - name: Create new container ring if required command: swift-ring-builder /tmp/swift-rings/etc/swift/container.builder create {{partpower}} {{replicas}} 1 when: cont_builder.stat.exists == False - name: Check if account.builder exists stat: path: /tmp/swift-rings/etc/swift/account.builder register: acc_builder - name: Create new account ring if required command: swift-ring-builder /tmp/swift-rings/etc/swift/account.builder create {{partpower}} {{replicas}} 1 when: acc_builder.stat.exists == False - name: Add all disks to object ring command: swift-ring-builder /tmp/swift-rings/etc/swift/object.builder add r1z1-{{item.host}}:{{obj_port}}/{{item.device}}1_ {{item.size}} with_items: "{{obj_devices}}" register: ringbuilder_cmd failed_when: ringbuilder_cmd.rc == 1 or ringbuilder_cmd.rc > 2 - name: Add all disks to container ring command: swift-ring-builder /tmp/swift-rings/etc/swift/container.builder add r1z1-{{item.host}}:{{cont_port}}/{{item.device}}1_ {{item.size}} with_items: "{{acc_cont_devices}}" register: ringbuilder_cmd failed_when: ringbuilder_cmd.rc == 1 or ringbuilder_cmd.rc > 2 - name: Add all disks to account ring command: swift-ring-builder /tmp/swift-rings/etc/swift/account.builder add r1z1-{{item.host}}:{{acc_port}}/{{item.device}}1_ {{item.size}} with_items: "{{acc_cont_devices}}" register: ringbuilder_cmd failed_when: ringbuilder_cmd.rc == 1 or ringbuilder_cmd.rc > 2 - name: Create partitions parted: number: 1 state: present device: /dev/{{ item.device }} with_items: "{{disks.devices}}" when: item.host == inventory_hostname and item.device != "d1" - name: Create filesystems filesystem: fstype: xfs dev: /dev/{{ item.device }}1 with_items: "{{disks.devices}}" when: item.host == inventory_hostname and item.device != "d1" - name: Mount filesystems mount: fstype: xfs path: /srv/node/{{ item.device }}1 src: /dev/{{ item.device }}1 state: mounted opts: noatime,nodiratime with_items: "{{disks.devices}}" when: item.host == inventory_hostname and item.device != "d1" - name: Create d1 directories if needed file: path: /srv/node/{{ item.device }} state: directory mode: 0755 owner: swift group: swift with_items: "{{disks.devices}}" when: item.host == inventory_hostname and item.device == "d1"

commit_message:
Refactor Zuul job using base jobs to consolidate the configuration

This change introduces tripleo-ci-base and tripleo-ci-undercloud-base job
to merge common parameters into single objects.

This change also removes un-needed statements already set in parent jobs,
such as "roles: zuul", "voting: true" or the "required-projects" list of
the container-update job.

Change-Id: I9c0658e6f103911bc62e9b3b78e369e6b4be4d23

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-17 12:27:56.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/upload-puppet-modules'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common/commit/b8fcaf08a7a967738692e9b98f46f206e0d81b44', 'message': 'Fix destination path when pushing puppet-elements

The current destination path when pushing puppet

created an issue as all the files in /etc/puppet/modules/
are symbolic links pointing to /usr/share/openstack-puppet/modules.

So, currently upload-puppet-modules creates a folder in

commit_message:
Fix destination path when pushing puppet-elements

The current destination path when pushing puppet
modules is hardwired to etc/puppet/modules. This
created an issue as all the files in /etc/puppet/modules/
are symbolic links pointing to /usr/share/openstack-puppet/modules.

So, currently upload-puppet-modules creates a folder in
/etc/puppet/modules/ not preserving the sym link and the
changes are not applied correctly when running the deployment.

Change-Id: Ia34436b907109efe9f7a7c275364d0f6a2c58061

commit_message:
WIP: Add instance reboot ssh test during upgrade

Change-Id: I29a69bc6f6633d5d7b0f9b59b64c5171ca3ebb68
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-upgrade refs/changes/58/553858/25 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/env bash FIP=$(openstack floating ip list -f json | jq -r -c '.[] | select(.Port) | .["Floating IP Address"]' | tail -1) while true; do ## Reboot instance via SSH ssh -q -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no cirros@$FIP 'sudo /sbin/reboot' ## Wait for instance to go down timeout_seconds=60 elapsed_seconds=0 while true; do echo "Waiting for $FIP instance to go down ..." INSTANCE_DOWN=$(ping -c1 $FIP) if [ $? != 0 ]; then break fi sleep 3 (( elapsed_seconds += 3 )) if [ $elapsed_seconds -ge $timeout_seconds ]; then echo "FAILURE: Instance $FIP didn't reboot in time" exit 1 fi done ## wait for instance to get back online timeout_seconds=60 elapsed_seconds=0 while true; do echo "Waiting for $FIP instance to boot ..." INSTANCE_UPTIME=$(ssh -q -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no -o ConnectTimeout=1 cirros@$FIP 'uptime' | awk {'print $3$4'} | sed s/,//) if [ $INSTANCE_UPTIME == '0min' ]; then echo "Instance $FIP successfully rebooted" break fi sleep 3 (( elapsed_seconds += 3 )) if [ $elapsed_seconds -ge $timeout_seconds ]; then echo "FAILURE: Instance $FIP didn't come back online" exit 1 fi done done

commit_message:
Handle root user case for ssh access creation

With the current approach, if we pass to the mistral workflow
overcloud_admin == root, it will create a root user instead
of amending the /root/.ssh/authorized_keys file for adding
the tripleo admin pub key.
This review set_facts for the admin-user, check and allow the
appropriate changes if the admin-user is 'root'

Change-Id: I9c6f09863ce49f4c7454eeec9945ba7d9bc89247
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/25/572325/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: set user variable for <% $.overcloud_admin %> set_fact: admin_user: '<% $.overcloud_admin %>' - name: set user home path set_fact: admin_user_home='/home/{{admin_user}}' when: admin_user != 'root' - name: set root user home path set_fact: admin_user_home='/{{admin_user}}' when: admin_user == 'root' name: '{{admin_user}}' dest: '/etc/sudoers.d/{{admin_user}}' {{admin_user}} ALL=(ALL) NOPASSWD:ALL when: admin_user != 'root' path: '{{admin_user_home}}/.ssh' owner: '{{admin_user}}' group: '{{admin_user}}' when: admin_user != 'root' path: '{{admin_user_home}}/.ssh/authorized_keys' owner: '{{admin_user}}' group: '{{admin_user}}' when: admin_user != 'root' path: '{{admin_user_home}}/.ssh/authorized_keys'

commit_message:
Rename container check script and package it

Rename container-update.py to container-check to match the original
script name at https://github.com/imain/container-check.

The goal is to start using the rpm packaged script from tripleo-common
instead of pip installing it in oooq-extra.

Change-Id: I437e532f04b521323466a2d6ff71db1d24f19d23

commit_message:
WIP, configure ARA for the overcloud deployment

In order to better understand the deployment,
task run times etc.. configure ARA for the
overcloud deployment.

To-Do:
* ensure this is only enabled in the
appropriate use cases.
* determine if any configuration is required on
the overcloud nodes themselves

Related-To: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/577960/
Change-Id: Iff110458cd21ec62b53825b27aff0c3cb06e8068

commit_message:
Remove obsolete section on compute ssh-key setup

Manual ssh key exchange is no longer required and is likely to clobber the ssh
config managed by tripleo.

bp tripleo-cold-migration

Change-Id: I139fd7029f593ad3ee956753f7bd9c92f2b5ffd1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-docs refs/changes/43/499543/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: Setting up Keys --------------- Assuming that the backing files for Nova VMs are not hosted on a shared storage volume (with all compute nodes having access), the compute nodes will need to be configured with ssh keys so that the `nova` user on each compute node has ssh access to the corresponding account on the other compute nodes. First, generate an ssh key:: ssh-keygen -t rsa -f nova_id_rsa Then, on each compute node, run the following script to set up the keys:: NOVA_SSH=/var/lib/nova/.ssh mkdir ${NOVA_SSH} cp nova_id_rsa ${NOVA_SSH}/id_rsa chmod 600 ${NOVA_SSH}/id_rsa cp nova_id_rsa.pub ${NOVA_SSH}/id_rsa.pub cp nova_id_rsa.pub ${NOVA_SSH}/authorized_keys chown -R nova.nova ${NOVA_SSH} # enable login for nova user on compute hosts: usermod -s /bin/bash nova # add ssh keys of overcloud nodes into known hosts: ssh-keyscan -t rsa `os-apply-config --key hosts --type raw --key-default '' | awk '{print $1}'` >>/etc/ssh/ssh_known_hosts

commit_message:
Add rspec tests for ironic stonith fence

Change-Id: Ic981642615a25b310474463ed3c9720aaf7eef91
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-pacemaker refs/changes/18/422218/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # # Copyright (C) 2017 Red Hat, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # require 'spec_helper' describe 'pacemaker::stonith::fence_ironic', type: :define do let(:title) { 'test' } shared_examples_for 'pacemaker::stonith::fence_ironic' do let(:stonith_name) { "stonith-fence_ironic-#{title}" } context 'with defaults' do it { is_expected.to contain_package('fence-agents-ironic') is_expected.to contain_exec("Create #{stonith_name}").with( :command => "/usr/sbin/pcs stonith create #{stonith_name} fence_ironic op monitor interval=60s", :unless => "/usr/sbin/pcs stonith show #{stonith_name} > /dev/null 2>&1" ) is_expected.to contain_exec("Add non-local constraint for #{stonith_name}").with( :command => "/usr/sbin/pcs constraint location #{stonith_name} avoids $(/usr/sbin/crm_node -n)" ) } end context 'with ensure absent' do let(:params) { { :ensure => 'absent' } } it { is_expected.to contain_exec('Delete stonith-fence_ironic-test').with( :command => '/usr/sbin/pcs stonith delete stonith-fence_ironic-test', :onlyif => '/usr/sbin/pcs stonith show stonith-fence_ironic-test > /dev/null 2>&1' ) is_expected.to_not contain_package('fence-agents-ironic') is_expected.to_not contain_exec('Create stonith-fence_ironic-test') is_expected.to_not contain_exec('Add non-local constraint for stonith-fence_ironic-test') } end context 'with params' do let(:params) { { :auth_url => 'auth_url', :passwd => 'passwd', :login => 'login', :timeout => 'timeout', :delay => 'delay', :pcmk_host_map => 'pcmk_host_map', :tries => 1, :try_sleep => 5, } } it { is_expected.to contain_package('fence-agents-ironic') is_expected.to contain_exec("Create #{stonith_name}").with( :command => "/usr/sbin/pcs stonith create #{stonith_name} fence_ironic auth-url=\"auth_url\" login=\"login\" passwd=\"passwd\" pcmk_host_map=\"pcmk_host_map\" timeout=\"timeout\" delay=\"delay\" op monitor interval=60s", :unless => "/usr/sbin/pcs stonith show #{stonith_name} > /dev/null 2>&1" ) is_expected.to contain_exec("Add non-local constraint for #{stonith_name}").with( :command => "/usr/sbin/pcs constraint location #{stonith_name} avoids pcmk_host_list", :tries => 1, :try_sleep => 5 ) } end end on_supported_os.each do |os, facts| context "on #{os}" do let(:facts) do facts.merge({ :hostname => 'node.example.com' }) end it_behaves_like 'pacemaker::stonith::fence_ironic' end end end

subject: Add upstart service support to ceph::mds
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-09 18:45:44.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/mds.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ceph/commit/4e5267185f46267530583764ad9265a3102aaa66', 'message': "Add upstart service support to ceph::mds

In line with ceph::mon, add support for a MDS on Ubuntu Trusty. Without this fix, Puppet outputs a error
on Ubuntu Trusty systems.

Debug: Service[ceph-mds@cephdev0](provider=upstart): Could not find ceph-mds@cephdev0.conf in /etc/init
Debug: Service[ceph-mds@cephdev0](provider=upstart): Could not find ceph-mds@cephdev0.conf in /etc/init.d
Debug: Service[ceph-mds@cephdev0](provider=upstart): Could not find ceph-mds@cephdev0 in /etc/init
Debug: Service[ceph-mds@cephdev0](provider=upstart): Could not find ceph-mds@cephdev0 in /etc/init.d
Debug: Service[ceph-mds@cephdev0](provider=upstart): Could not find ceph-mds@cephdev0.sh in /etc/init
Debug: Service[ceph-mds@cephdev0](provider=upstart): Could not find ceph-mds@cephdev0.sh in /etc/init.d
Error: /Stage[main]/Ceph::Mds/Service[ceph-mds@cephdev0]: Could not evaluate: Could not find init script or upstart conf file for 'ceph-mds@cephdev0'

The ceph-mds package for Trusty only contains upstart init scripts (and systemd), therefor the ceph::mds code
should use the 'ceph-mds' service name.

$ dpkg-deb -c ceph-mds_10.2.7-1trusty_amd64.deb |grep init
drwxr-xr-x root/root         0 2017-04-10 14:18 ./etc/init/
-rw-r--r-- root/root       584 2017-04-10 14:18 ./etc/init/ceph-mds-all-starter.conf
-rw-r--r-- root/root       619 2017-04-10 14:18 ./etc/init/ceph-mds.conf
-rw-r--r-- root/root        93 2017-04-10 14:18 ./etc/init/ceph-mds-all.conf

Change-Id: I22c7b57871891323d31d4f9764956d17a284ed4e
"}]
commit_message:
Add upstart service support to ceph::mds

In line with ceph::mon, add support for a MDS on Ubuntu Trusty. Without this fix, Puppet outputs a error
on Ubuntu Trusty systems.

Debug: Service[ceph-mds@cephdev0](provider=upstart): Could not find ceph-mds@cephdev0.conf in /etc/init
Debug: Service[ceph-mds@cephdev0](provider=upstart): Could not find ceph-mds@cephdev0.conf in /etc/init.d
Debug: Service[ceph-mds@cephdev0](provider=upstart): Could not find ceph-mds@cephdev0 in /etc/init
Debug: Service[ceph-mds@cephdev0](provider=upstart): Could not find ceph-mds@cephdev0 in /etc/init.d
Debug: Service[ceph-mds@cephdev0](provider=upstart): Could not find ceph-mds@cephdev0.sh in /etc/init
Debug: Service[ceph-mds@cephdev0](provider=upstart): Could not find ceph-mds@cephdev0.sh in /etc/init.d
Error: /Stage[main]/Ceph::Mds/Service[ceph-mds@cephdev0]: Could not evaluate: Could not find init script or upstart conf file for 'ceph-mds@cephdev0'

The ceph-mds package for Trusty only contains upstart init scripts (and systemd), therefor the ceph::mds code
should use the 'ceph-mds' service name.

$ dpkg-deb -c ceph-mds_10.2.7-1trusty_amd64.deb |grep init
drwxr-xr-x root/root         0 2017-04-10 14:18 ./etc/init/
-rw-r--r-- root/root       584 2017-04-10 14:18 ./etc/init/ceph-mds-all-starter.conf
-rw-r--r-- root/root       619 2017-04-10 14:18 ./etc/init/ceph-mds.conf
-rw-r--r-- root/root        93 2017-04-10 14:18 ./etc/init/ceph-mds-all.conf

commit_message:
Include keystone::policy class into init.pp manifest.

Without inclusion of keystone::policy class it is impossible to
deploy customized keystone policies using policy.pp manifest.

Change-Id: Ib5622547a1b720dc5aa8afc140903c86ffe0339d
Closes-Bug: #1690318

added_lines: include ::keystone::policy

commit_message:
Add support for managing caching layers, erasure pools, crushmap buckets and crush rulesets

Change-Id: Ib13134b2c972f0caf00d5545488feeab70eb5c54
Signed-off-by: Tom Verdaat <tom@server.biz>
Co-Authored-By: Alex Schultz <aschultz@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ceph refs/changes/50/466050/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # # Copyright 2017 Server.Biz # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. # # Author: Tom Verdaat <tom@server.biz> # # Creates CRUSH map rule # # == Define: ceph::rule # # The name of the rule. # # === Parameters: # # [*ensure*] Creates ( present ) or removes ( absent ) a CRUSH ruleset. # Optional. Defaults to present. # If set to absent, it will drop the CRUSH ruleset. # # [*type*] Type of ruleset. # Optional. String. # Defaults to 'replicated'. Can also be set to 'erasure'. # # [*root*] Rule starts from. # Optional. String. # Optional. Default is undef. # # [*bucket*] Replicate across buckets of type # Optional. String. # Optional. Default is undef. # # [*mode*] Use choose mode. # Optional. String. # Defaults to 'firstn'. Recommend 'indep' best for erasure pools # # [*profile*] Erasure coding profile. # Optional. String. # Defaults to 'default'. # define ceph::rule ( $ensure = 'present', $type = 'replicated', $root = undef, $bucket = undef, $mode = 'firstn', $profile = 'default', ){ if ($ensure == 'present') { if ($type != 'replicated') and ($type != 'erasure') { fail("Invalid type supplied for crush rule '${name}', must either be 'replicated' or 'erasure'.") } if ($mode != 'firstn') and ($mode != 'indep') { fail("Invalid mode supplied for crush rule '${name}', must either be 'firstn' or 'indep'.") } Ceph::Mon <| |> -> Exec["create-${name}"] Ceph::Bucket <| |> -> Exec["create-${name}"] if ($type == 'replicated') { exec { "create-${name}": command => "/bin/true # comment to satisfy puppet syntax requirements set -ex ceph osd crush rule create-simple ${name} ${root} ${bucket} ${mode}", unless => "/bin/true # comment to satisfy puppet syntax requirements set -ex ceph osd crush rule list | grep -q '\"${name}\"'", } } else { exec { "create-${name}": command => "/bin/true # comment to satisfy puppet syntax requirements set -ex ceph osd crush rule create-erasure ${name} ${profile}", unless => "/bin/true # comment to satisfy puppet syntax requirements set -ex ceph osd crush rule list | grep -q '\"${name}\"'", require => Ceph::Profile[$profile], } } } elsif ($ensure == 'absent') { exec { "delete-${name}": command => "/bin/true # comment to satisfy puppet syntax requirements set -ex ceph osd crush rule rm ${name}", onlyif => "/bin/true # comment to satisfy puppet syntax requirements set -ex ceph osd crush rule list | grep -q '\"${name}\"'", require => Package['ceph'] } } }

commit_message:
Do not load openstack_dashboard.settings in unit tests

The previous behavior depends on different values for
SELECTABLE_THEMES and it seems this is the reason that test_themes
imported openstack_dashboard.settings.
If we override a value in django.conf.settings, we can use
override_settings decorator. This commit uses it and
we can now avoid importing openstack_dashboard.settings in UT.

Change-Id: Id1b7b7e431b86e725ad897613ca38f423a67e52d
Closes-Bug: #1809842

subject: Use renamed template 'integrated-gate-py3'
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-12-19 04:12:21.000000000', 'files': ['.zuul.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/b294a17e3484d056e1bf388e33de89b248aad715', 'message': "Use renamed template 'integrated-gate-py3'

'integrated-gate-py35' template is going to be
renamed to 'integrated-gate-py3' in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/626078/

Integrated jobs are running on Bionic now where python 3.6 is available.
Which means gate jobs in 'integrated-gate-py35' template are
running on python 3.6 not on 3.5 which makes this template name confusing.

depends on commit rename the 'integrated-gate-py35' to 'integrated-gate-py3'
so that it can convey that template will use available python 3 version
in used distro. For example: 3.5 in xenial and 3.6 in bionic.

This commit starts using the new template name so that old
template name can be removed.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/626078/
Change-Id: Ic5264b3b79d0a4caaa7f466f8686d38f54fe1ffe
"}]
commit_message:
Use renamed template 'integrated-gate-py3'

'integrated-gate-py35' template is going to be
renamed to 'integrated-gate-py3' in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/626078/

Integrated jobs are running on Bionic now where python 3.6 is available.
Which means gate jobs in 'integrated-gate-py35' template are
running on python 3.6 not on 3.5 which makes this template name confusing.

depends on commit rename the 'integrated-gate-py35' to 'integrated-gate-py3'
so that it can convey that template will use available python 3 version
in used distro. For example: 3.5 in xenial and 3.6 in bionic.

This commit starts using the new template name so that old
template name can be removed.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/626078/
Change-Id: Ic5264b3b79d0a4caaa7f466f8686d38f54fe1ffe
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/79/626079/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - integrated-gate-py3

commit_message:
Fix bug for Download, and install elasticsearch server

If devstack is not in the $DEST directory,
The elasticsearch package will fail when downloading
and installing in freezer-api.

Change-Id: Iec29c2885b53756564a0bf23c7518f6cf848851a

subject: [Doc] Fix status and parameters of vol connection api
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-11-14 03:51:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/800d78c27adc30e3d51968886f4f858e8168260c', 'message': '[Doc] Fix status and parameters of vol connection api

The response 'status' of initialize connection is 200, and the
"connector" parameter is required in initialize/terminate connection
API request.

commit_message:
[Doc] Fix status and parameters of vol connection api

The response 'status' of initialize connection is 200, and the
"connector" parameter is required in initialize/terminate connection
API request.

This patch try to fix these wrong content.

Change-Id: I9d8c7c951b03f10fa29e3b3cc107a17e37b0e2bc

subject: Deprecate old keystone session config opts
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-12-26 20:37:30.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/configuration/tables/manila-generic.inc', 'manila/volume/cinder.py', 'manila/network/neutron/api.py', 'manila/tests/common/test_client_auth.py', 'manila/compute/nova.py', 'manila/tests/volume/test_cinder.py', 'manila/tests/compute/test_nova.py', 'manila/common/client_auth.py', 'releasenotes/notes/deprecate-old-ks-opts-in-nova-neutron-cinder-groups-e395015088d93fdc.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/commit/4947cb0f6c610d5abf6d34d20bb50febd5b0239b', 'message': 'Deprecate old keystone session config opts

In the past, the options ca_certificates_file,
nova_ca_certificates_file, cinder_ca_certificates_file,
api_insecure, nova_api_insecure, cinder_api_insecure
were supplied to instantiate nova, neutron and cinder
clients. These options have now been subsumed in a more
generic way into the Keystone session logic as 'cafile'
and 'insecure'. Deprecate the older options in Stein so
that we can remove them in a future release.

This deprecation began many releases ago when we switched
to using keystone sessions [1]. However, we were still
overriding the values of "insecure" and "cafile" if provided,
forcing users to continue using deprecated parameters
"api_insecure" and "ca_certificates_file". So despite
this fix originating in the Stein release, it would be
prudent to backport it to all maintained releases and
remove support for these older options in/beyond Train
release (9.0.0).

[1] Ic211a11308a3295409467efd88bff413482ee58d
Change-Id: I148e9079c7c1ab119f519f727d4ad97758473325
Related-Bug: #1802393
Closes-Bug: #1809318
(cherry picked from commit 198bea78ac01aaf8a703ca7878b2a85a1b59667e)
'}]
commit_message:
Deprecate old keystone session config opts

In the past, the options ca_certificates_file,
nova_ca_certificates_file, cinder_ca_certificates_file,
api_insecure, nova_api_insecure, cinder_api_insecure
were supplied to instantiate nova, neutron and cinder
clients. These options have now been subsumed in a more
generic way into the Keystone session logic as 'cafile'
and 'insecure'. Deprecate the older options in Stein so
that we can remove them in a future release.

This deprecation began many releases ago when we switched
to using keystone sessions [1]. However, we were still
overriding the values of "insecure" and "cafile" if provided,
forcing users to continue using deprecated parameters
"api_insecure" and "ca_certificates_file". So despite
this fix originating in the Stein release, it would be
prudent to backport it to all maintained releases and
remove support for these older options in/beyond Train
release (9.0.0).

[1] Ic211a11308a3295409467efd88bff413482ee58d
Change-Id: I148e9079c7c1ab119f519f727d4ad97758473325
Related-Bug: #1802393
Closes-Bug: #1809318
(cherry picked from commit 198bea78ac01aaf8a703ca7878b2a85a1b59667e)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/18/627418/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | `Launchpad bug 1809318 <https://bugs.launchpad.net/manila/+bug/1809318>`_ has been fixed. The deprecated options ``api_insecure`` and ``ca_certificates_file`` from nova, cinder, neutron or DEFAULT configuration groups no longer override the newer ``insecure`` option if provided. Always use ``insecure`` and ``cafile`` to control SSL and validation since the deprecated options will be removed in a future release. deprecations: - | The options ``ca_certificates_file``, ``nova_ca_certificates_file``, ``cinder_ca_certificates_file``, ``api_insecure``, ``nova_api_insecure`` and ``cinder_api_insecure`` have been deprecated from the ``DEFAULT`` group as well as ``nova``, ``neutron`` and ``cinder`` configuration groups. Use ``cafile`` to specify the CA certificates and ``insecure`` to turn off SSL validation in these respective groups (nova, neutron and cinder).

commit_message:
Fix image_name retrieval in custom-image jobs

And use a 'file://' url for the custom manila image.

See also https://review.openstack.org/#/c/623330.  These
are interdependent patches but no harm is done by merging
this one first and having 623330 depend on it since retrieval
of the image name is not working correctly anyways.

Partial-Bug: #1807969

Change-Id: Ib3a74d170f159dfbc38b5302f00800f3530f4921
(cherry picked from commit 6299ed5ed001ae2768ed2b954730b526b4053b2c)

commit_message:
Add 'Review-Priority' for Kolla repos

Following the work done for Designate with
Id7b4c6b219899fa7ed86554257264af7efe20408, this adds a Review-Priority
label for Kolla projects to allow easier priority dashboard creation and a
cleaner way to do procedural blocking during freezes.

Change-Id: I03b71534173899b2c22987f199d1753472842a12

commit_message:
Fix global lock path usage

The option `systemd_lock_path` is intended to be set globally
and locally however the global implementation has never been
implemented.

  * The global option will ensure the run and lock path is setup
    for all services within the `systemd_services` array.
  * The local option provices a way to override a global lock path
    based on specific service needs.

Change-Id: I373b8905c01ff666b5705bd3bb3c76c3e74a64ab
(cherry picked from commit 86ad639f4171b0c01bba030ebc3fd96ec020aa45)

commit_message:
Delete related encryption provider when a volume type is deleting

Currently volume_type_destroy() in api.py does not delete related
encryption provider (if it exists). As a result, 'encryption' table
accumulates orphaned records.
This patch fixes to delete related encryption provider when
a volume type is deleting.

Change-Id: I6472c5516dea8f81b362753b2f2a68ac5c15874a

subject: Support Docker CE in bootstrap-servers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-07-13 14:58:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible/commit/c0b9fb5ce946dd3cf51eaee7f5fa48d21ecf020e', 'message': "WIP: Support Docker CE for CentOS in bootstrap-servers

Kolla Ansible's bootstrap-servers command provides support for
installing the Docker engine. This is currently done using the packages
at https://apt.dockerproject.org and https://yum.dockerproject.org.
These packages are outdated, with the most recent packages from May 2017
- docker-engine-17.05.

The source for up to date docker packages is
https://download.docker.com, which was introduced with the move to
Docker Community Edition (CE) and Docker Enterprise Edition (EE).

This change adds support to bootstrap-servers for Docker CE for CentOS.
It also adds a new variable, 'docker_legacy_packages', which controls
whether the legacy packages at dockerproject.org will be used (the
default) or the newer packages at docker.com.

Change-Id: I6dfd375c868870f8646ef1a8f02c70812e8f6271
Partially-Implements: blueprint docker-ce

"}, {'number': 12, 'created': '2018-11-21 19:10:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible/commit/2b3ef58e9618a2171cb4b057a554795dd6be62af', 'message': "Support Docker CE in bootstrap-servers

Kolla Ansible's bootstrap-servers command provides support for
installing the Docker engine. This is currently done using the packages
at https://apt.dockerproject.org and https://yum.dockerproject.org.
These packages are outdated, with the most recent packages from May 2017
- docker-engine-17.05.

The source for up to date docker packages is
https://download.docker.com, which was introduced with the move to
Docker Community Edition (CE) and Docker Enterprise Edition (EE).

This change adds support to bootstrap-servers for Docker CE for CentOS
and Ubuntu.

It also adds a new variable, 'enable_docker_repo', which controls
whether a package repository for Docker will be enabled.

It also adds a new variable, 'docker_legacy_packages', which controls
whether the legacy packages at dockerproject.org will be used or the
newer packages at docker.com.

Due to concerns about using Docker CE on Red Hat family OS, legacy
packages are used there by default. Docker CE is used by default for
Debian family OS.

Upgrading from docker-engine to docker-ce has been tested on CentOS 7.5
and Ubuntu 16.04, by running 'kolla-ansible bootstrap-servers' with
'docker_legacy_packages' set to 'false'. The upgrades were successful,
and resulted in a restart of the Docker engine and all containers.

Change-Id: I6dfd375c868870f8646ef1a8f02c70812e8f6271
Implements: blueprint docker-ce
"}, {'number': 13, 'created': '2018-12-13 16:08:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible/commit/523c9a6c3f23ef763a1cc0b13cb4fd62431ad443', 'message': "Support Docker CE in bootstrap-servers

Docker Community Edition (CE) and Docker Enterprise Edition (EE).

This change adds support to bootstrap-servers for Docker CE for CentOS
and Ubuntu.

It also adds a new variable, 'enable_docker_repo', which controls
whether a package repository for Docker will be enabled.

It also adds a new variable, 'docker_legacy_packages', which controls
whether the legacy packages at dockerproject.org will be used or the
newer packages at docker.com.

Due to concerns about using Docker CE on Red Hat family OS, legacy
packages are used there by default. Docker CE is used by default for
Debian family OS.

Upgrading from docker-engine to docker-ce has been tested on CentOS 7.5
and Ubuntu 16.04, by running 'kolla-ansible bootstrap-servers' with
'docker_legacy_packages' set to 'false'. The upgrades were successful,
and resulted in a restart of the Docker engine and all containers.

Change-Id: I6dfd375c868870f8646ef1a8f02c70812e8f6271
Implements: blueprint docker-ce
"}, {'number': 14, 'created': '2018-12-14 12:46:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible/commit/152cc3e64bcfc1cfd667a2c9e6ecec18526c2f1b', 'message': "Support Docker CE in bootstrap-servers

Kolla Ansible's bootstrap-servers command provides support for
installing the Docker engine. This is currently done using the packages
at https://apt.dockerproject.org and https://yum.dockerproject.org.
These packages are outdated, with the most recent packages from May 2017
- docker-engine-17.05.

The source for up to date docker packages is
https://download.docker.com, which was introduced with the move to
Docker Community Edition (CE) and Docker Enterprise Edition (EE).

This change adds support to bootstrap-servers for Docker CE for CentOS
and Ubuntu.

It also adds a new variable, 'enable_docker_repo', which controls
whether a package repository for Docker will be enabled.

It also adds a new variable, 'docker_legacy_packages', which controls
whether the legacy packages at dockerproject.org will be used or the
newer packages at docker.com. The default value for this variable is
'false', meaning to use Docker CE.

Upgrading from docker-engine to docker-ce has been tested on CentOS 7.5
and Ubuntu 16.04, by running 'kolla-ansible bootstrap-servers' with
'docker_legacy_packages' set to 'false'. The upgrades were successful,
but result in all containers being stopped. For this reason, the
bootstrap-servers command checks running containers prior to upgrading
packages, and ensures they are running after the package upgrade is
complete.

As mentioned in the release note, care should be taken when upgrading
Docker with clustered services, which could lose quorum. To avoid this,
use --serial or --limit to apply the change in batches.

Change-Id: I6dfd375c868870f8646ef1a8f02c70812e8f6271
Implements: blueprint docker-ce

installing the Docker engine. This is currently done using the packages
at https://apt.dockerproject.org and https://yum.dockerproject.org.

- docker-engine-17.05.

The source for up to date docker packages is
https://download.docker.com, which was introduced with the move to
Docker Community Edition (CE) and Docker Enterprise Edition (EE).

This change adds support to bootstrap-servers for Docker CE for CentOS
and Ubuntu.

It also adds a new variable, 'enable_docker_repo', which controls
whether a package repository for Docker will be enabled.

It also adds a new variable, 'docker_legacy_packages', which controls
whether the legacy packages at dockerproject.org will be used or the
newer packages at docker.com. The default value for this variable is
'false', meaning to use Docker CE.

Upgrading from docker-engine to docker-ce has been tested on CentOS 7.5
and Ubuntu 16.04, by running 'kolla-ansible bootstrap-servers' with
'docker_legacy_packages' set to 'false'. The upgrades were successful,
but result in all containers being stopped. For this reason, the
bootstrap-servers command checks running containers prior to upgrading
packages, and ensures they are running after the package upgrade is
complete.

As mentioned in the release note, care should be taken when upgrading
Docker with clustered services, which could lose quorum. To avoid this,
use --serial or --limit to apply the change in batches.

commit_message:
Support Docker CE in bootstrap-servers

Kolla Ansible's bootstrap-servers command provides support for
installing the Docker engine. This is currently done using the packages
at https://apt.dockerproject.org and https://yum.dockerproject.org.
These packages are outdated, with the most recent packages from May 2017
- docker-engine-17.05.

The source for up to date docker packages is
https://download.docker.com, which was introduced with the move to
Docker Community Edition (CE) and Docker Enterprise Edition (EE).

This change adds support to bootstrap-servers for Docker CE for CentOS
and Ubuntu.

It also adds a new variable, 'enable_docker_repo', which controls
whether a package repository for Docker will be enabled.

It also adds a new variable, 'docker_legacy_packages', which controls
whether the legacy packages at dockerproject.org will be used or the
newer packages at docker.com. The default value for this variable is
'false', meaning to use Docker CE.

Upgrading from docker-engine to docker-ce has been tested on CentOS 7.5
and Ubuntu 16.04, by running 'kolla-ansible bootstrap-servers' with
'docker_legacy_packages' set to 'false'. The upgrades were successful,
but result in all containers being stopped. For this reason, the
bootstrap-servers command checks running containers prior to upgrading
packages, and ensures they are running after the package upgrade is
complete.

As mentioned in the release note, care should be taken when upgrading
Docker with clustered services, which could lose quorum. To avoid this,
use --serial or --limit to apply the change in batches.

Change-Id: I6dfd375c868870f8646ef1a8f02c70812e8f6271
Implements: blueprint docker-ce
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/12/582612/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Whether to use the legacy Docker packages at dockerproject.org instead of the # newer packages at docker.com. # TODO: Set this to true before merging. docker_legacy_packages: false # Docker APT repository configuration.# Docker Yum repository configuration. docker_yum_url: "{% if docker_legacy_packages | bool %}{{ docker_legacy_yum_url }}{% else %}{{ docker_new_yum_url }}{% endif %}" docker_yum_baseurl: "{% if docker_legacy_packages | bool %}{{ docker_legacy_yum_baseurl }}{% else %}{{ docker_new_yum_baseurl }}{% endif %}" docker_yum_gpgkey: "{% if docker_legacy_packages | bool %}{{ docker_legacy_yum_gpgkey }}{% else %}{{ docker_new_yum_gpgkey }}{% endif %}" docker_yum_gpgcheck: true # Docker Yum repository configuration when docker_legacy_packages is false. docker_new_yum_url: "https://download.docker.com/linux/{{ ansible_distribution | lower }}" docker_new_yum_baseurl: "{{ docker_yum_url }}/{{ ansible_distribution_major_version | lower }}/$basearch/stable" docker_new_yum_gpgkey: "{{ docker_yum_url }}/gpg" # Docker Yum repository configuration when docker_legacy_packages is true. docker_legacy_yum_url: "https://yum.dockerproject.org" docker_legacy_yum_baseurl: "{{ docker_legacy_yum_url }}/repo/main/{{ ansible_distribution | lower }}/{{ ansible_distribution_major_version | lower }}" docker_legacy_yum_gpgkey: "{{ docker_legacy_yum_url }}/gpg" - "{{ 'docker-engine-1.12.0' if docker_legacy_packages | bool else 'docker-ce' }}" - "{% if not docker_legacy_packages | bool %}docker-engine{% endif %}"

commit_message:
Improve metric error handling

flush() should not produce a metric if value is None (causes
exception in monasca-api).
Fix the exception message in flush() to use the correct data
structure.

Change-Id: I62d31270db9e70f16d2a38a73856009c52c098e6
Story: 2004276
Task: 27825
(cherry picked from commit f2e1f03fc834d2accdfc642c69b43f07e4319fcc)

commit_message:
Stack Update - NetworkDeploymentActions

Add a page regarding network configuration changes in post
deployment. Network configuration changes are disabled by
default, parameter override is required to enable network
re-configuration when necessary.

Related-Bug: #1804642
Change-Id: I0f834af0391649ac51e41fc1e9bbf3db458beac6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-docs refs/changes/21/626721/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. _update_network_configuration_post_deploymenet: Updating network configuration on the Overcloud after a deployment ================================================================== By default, subsequent change(s) made to network configuration templates (bonding options, mtu, bond type, etc) are not applied on existing nodes when the overcloud stack is updated. .. Warning:: Network configuration updates are disabled by default to avoid issues that may arise from network reconfiguration. Network configuration updates should only be enabled when needed. To push an updated network configuration add ``UPDATE`` to list of actions set in the ``NetworkDeploymentActions`` parameter. (The default is ``['CREATE']``, to enable network configuration on stack update it must be changed to: ``['CREATE','UPDATE']``.) * Enable update of the network configuration for all roles by adding the following to ``parameter_defaults`` in an environment file:: parameter_defaults: NetworkDeploymentActions: ['CREATE','UPDATE'] * Limit the network configuration update to nodes of a specific role by using a role-specific parameter, i.e: ``{role.name}NetworkDeploymentActions``. For example to update the network configuration on the nodes in the Compute role, add the following to ``parameter_defaults`` in an environment file:: parameter_defaults: ComputeNetworkDeploymentActions: ['CREATE','UPDATE']

subject: Implement front end rate-limiting for Cinder volume

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-08-18 10:04:28.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_libvirt_volume.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/volume.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/f9cf84273bd4d89cdbe267b2a5ed9c9ed20492e9', 'message': 'Implement front end rate-limiting for Cinder volume

Cinder adds Quality-of-Service control interface to allow admin to
specify QoS parameters as well as the place where these parameters
should be consumed (Front-end: Nova Compute, Back-end: Cinder
Volume, or Both) for volume types.  KVM and other hypervisor is
known to be able to do disk rate-limit control (one form of QoS)
for virtual disks, this patch enables Nova Compute to extract
rate-limit parameters for volumes while attaching, currently
libvirt only.

implement bp volume-rate-limiting

Change-Id: Ibcc8f15ab744600e6f814b46935f8022d78074fc
'}]
commit_message:
Implement front end rate-limiting for Cinder volume

Cinder adds Quality-of-Service control interface to allow admin to
specify QoS parameters as well as the place where these parameters
should be consumed (Front-end: Nova Compute, Back-end: Cinder
Volume, or Both) for volume types.  KVM and other hypervisor is
known to be able to do disk rate-limit control (one form of QoS)
for virtual disks, this patch enables Nova Compute to extract
rate-limit parameters for volumes while attaching, currently
libvirt only.

implement bp volume-rate-limiting

Change-Id: Ibcc8f15ab744600e6f814b46935f8022d78074fc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/21/42521/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Extract rate_limit control parameters if 'qos_specs' in data and data['qos_specs']: tune_opts = ['total_bytes_sec', 'read_bytes_sec', 'write_bytes_sec', 'total_iops_sec', 'read_iops_sec', 'write_iops_sec'] specs = data['qos_specs'] if isinstance(specs, dict): for k, v in specs.iteritems(): if k in tune_opts: new_key = 'disk_' + k setattr(conf, new_key, v) else: LOG.warn(_('Unknown content in connection_info/' 'qos_specs: %s') % specs)

commit_message:
Remove standalone quickstart.sh gating_repo var

The compreosed_gating_repo is set by the build-test-packages role to
denote that a gating_repo is generated in case of change at tq or tqe
this gating repo is not generated and the fact is not set, if we force
the fact it will  be a false positive for gating repo.

Change-Id: Id20a048bf895aabf13656c7ce4d5ba1873e74cb7

commit_message:
[cinder,glance] don't randomize job names

Random job names mean `helm upgrade` or indeed anything looks for
changes from rendered templates will see changes when there are none
causing churn and restarts.

Change-Id: I44331e00c288b517fccf69a4b60435efa2e13d61

commit_message:
Add BootParams service to ovb-ha

BootParams service allows to set the kernel args, reboot and wait
for the node reboot to complete, only when the KenelArgs is
applied on a role parameter. Enabling the service for ovb-ha
and added a env file for setting KernelArgs so that it can be
applied on oooq featureset config.

Change-Id: I777f3193bcf8feb12b6935808470ed94a3fefd6c

subject: Fix global lock path usage
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-12-27 23:59:54.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/main.yml', 'templates/systemd-tmpfiles.j2', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ansible-role-systemd_service/commit/86ad639f4171b0c01bba030ebc3fd96ec020aa45', 'message': 'Fix global lock path usage

The option `systemd_lock_path` is intended to be set globally
and locally however the global implementation has never been
implemented.

  * The global option will ensure the run and lock path is setup
    for all services within the `systemd_services` array.
  * The local option provices a way to override a global lock path
    based on specific service needs.

Change-Id: I373b8905c01ff666b5705bd3bb3c76c3e74a64ab
'}]
commit_message:
Fix global lock path usage

The option `systemd_lock_path` is intended to be set globally
and locally however the global implementation has never been
implemented.

  * The global option will ensure the run and lock path is setup
    for all services within the `systemd_services` array.
  * The local option provices a way to override a global lock path
    based on specific service needs.

Change-Id: I373b8905c01ff666b5705bd3bb3c76c3e74a64ab
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ansible-role-systemd_service refs/changes/77/627577/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Global lock path used for system services. # This is an optional variable and will have no effect if undefined. # This option can also be defined for specific service entries under "systemd_services". # systemd_lock_path: "/var/lock/service1"

commit_message:
Ironic Inspector - disjoint ip range(s) for HA

Allow tht parameter IronicInspectorSubnets to specify
per-instance ip range(s) using hostname as key for each
list of ip ranges. For HA deployments use disjoint
address pools to avoid potential address conflict.

Implements: blueprint ironic-inspector-overcloud
Change-Id: Ifae513265b8c35d98012f14f951bac33ae90b66c
(cherry picked from commit c2d84b4fee03e022a51c34853801ed10d27c0025)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/14/625314/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*inspection_subnets*] # IP ranges that will be given to nodes during the inspection # process. Either a list of ip ranged or a dictionary with $::hostname as # key to enable HA deployments using disjoint address pools served by the # DHCP instances. # # Example for Non-HA deployment, a list of ip-ranges: # - ip_range: 192.168.0.100,192.168.0.120 # - ip_range: 192.168.1.100,192.168.1.200 # netmask: 255.255.255.0 # gateway: 192.168.1.254 # tag: subnet1 # # Example for HA deployment using disjoint address pools: # overcloud-ironic-0: # - ip_range: 192.168.24.100,192.168.24.119 # - ip_range: 192.168.25.100,192.168.25.119 # netmask: 255.255.255.0 # gateway: 192.168.25.254 # tag: subnet1 # overcloud-ironic-1: # - ip_range: 192.168.24.120,192.168.24.139 # - ip_range: 192.168.25.120,192.168.25.139 # netmask: 255.255.255.0 # gateway: 192.168.25.254 # tag: subnet1 # $inspection_subnets = [], $bootstrap_node = hiera('bootstrap_nodeid', undef), $step = Integer(hiera('step')), if is_hash($inspection_subnets) { $inspection_subnets_real = $inspection_subnets[$::hostname] } elsif is_array($inspection_subnets) { $inspection_subnets_real = $inspection_subnets } # TODO(hjensas): Once https://review.openstack.org/557465 is merged remove # the condition. if $inspection_subnets != [] { class { '::ironic::inspector': sync_db => $sync_db, dnsmasq_ip_subnets => $inspection_subnets_real, } } else { class { '::ironic::inspector': sync_db => $sync_db, }

commit_message:
Allow user to define a custom tuned profile

Add custom_profile parameter to tripleo::profile::base::tuned
which may a string in INI format describing a tuned profile
which puppet will then create and apply with the name supplied
by the profile parameter.

Change-Id: Iba17d86bbdd710623ba1ba44b1ea5d4c1b99c541
Related-Bug: #1800232
(cherry picked from commit 3c953e877b74f2c4d93e57d3b093d9171e897e72)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/11/625111/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: context 'with custom profile' do let :params do { :profile => 'custom', :custom_profile => 'foo' } end it 'should create a custom tuned profile' do is_expected.to contain_file('/etc/tuned/custom/tuned.conf').with({ 'content' => 'foo', 'owner' => 'root', 'group' => 'root', 'mode' => '0644', }) end it 'should run a tuned-adm exec to set the custom profile' do is_expected.to contain_exec('tuned-adm').with_command( 'tuned-adm profile custom' ) end end end

commit_message:
Use puppet4 functions-api

Change-Id: I3aad89ddc53d08c4357dd278f8dc6560137ab0ae
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova refs/changes/41/614241/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: require 'json' # Convert input array of hashes (optionally JSON encoded) # to a puppet Array of JSON encoded Strings. Puppet::Functions.create_function(:to_array_of_json_strings) do def to_array_of_json_strings(*args) list = args[0] if list.class == String begin begin list = JSON.load(list) rescue JSON::ParserError # If parsing failed it could be a legacy format that uses single quotes. # NB This will corrupt valid JSON data, e.g {"foo": "\'"} => {"foo": "\""} list = JSON.load(list.gsub("'","\"")) Puppet.warning("#{args[0]} is not valid JSON. Support for this format is deprecated and may be removed in future.") end rescue JSON::ParserError raise Puppet::ParseError, "Syntax error: #{args[0]} is not valid" end end unless list.class == Array or (list.each { |e| return false unless e.class == Hash }) raise Puppet::ParseError, "Syntax error: #{args[0]} is not an Array or JSON encoded String" end rv = [] list.each do |e| rv.push(e.to_json) end return rv end end

commit_message:
ceilometer: escape % in crontab

% in cron is a reserved character and must be escape.

Change-Id: Ic5c4a6126f42c700a8534c3c4d30f5951e4718ae
Closes-bug: #1790503
(cherry picked from commit 10074cd5989df1093c4dedde98e28d9a9dcb7de6)

added_lines: :command => 'sleep $(($(od -A n -t d -N 3 /dev/urandom) \\% 86400)) && ceilometer-expirer'

subject: Use correct case for WEBSSO_ENABLED config setting
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-12-22 02:55:03.000000000', 'files': ['templates/local_settings.py.erb'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-horizon/commit/f3238a81d85c8840585bdc5f4c3aca28fee7a283', 'message': 'Use correct case for WEBSSO_ENABLED config setting

Horizon is picky about the case of the value used for the
WEBSSO_ENABLED setting in local_settings.  When enabled, it expects
the value to be "True".  Currently, we set it to "true", which
causes Horizon to throw a 500 error when accessing the login page.
This patch sets the value using the proper case.

Change-Id: Ic71a6c4b50556a1820a5f86bfc5a3e5102955c7b
'}]
commit_message:
Use correct case for WEBSSO_ENABLED config setting

Horizon is picky about the case of the value used for the
WEBSSO_ENABLED setting in local_settings.  When enabled, it expects
the value to be "True".  Currently, we set it to "true", which
causes Horizon to throw a 500 error when accessing the login page.
This patch sets the value using the proper case.

Change-Id: Ic71a6c4b50556a1820a5f86bfc5a3e5102955c7b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-horizon refs/changes/27/627027/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: WEBSSO_ENABLED = True

subject: Correct openid federation protocol name in httpd template
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-12-20 04:07:46.000000000', 'files': ['templates/openidc.conf.erb'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-keystone/commit/95f02a40e095a1e32774c4d618acf0cbbea35d96', 'message': "Correct openid federation protocol name in httpd template

Keystone requires the auth method for federation using OpenID
Connect to be 'openid', which we already enforce in puppet-keystone.
The protocol name that shows up in the federation URLs in the httpd
config must match the auth method.  We have a few locations that
don't match, which results in an invalid configuration.

This patch corrects the protocol in the locations protected by
mod_auth_openidc and the OIDCRedirectURI directives.

Change-Id: I02027676c532b447e56c8774c25015ec9a40b414
"}]
commit_message:
Correct openid federation protocol name in httpd template

Keystone requires the auth method for federation using OpenID
Connect to be 'openid', which we already enforce in puppet-keystone.
The protocol name that shows up in the federation URLs in the httpd
config must match the auth method.  We have a few locations that
don't match, which results in an invalid configuration.

This patch corrects the protocol in the locations protected by
mod_auth_openidc and the OIDCRedirectURI directives.

Change-Id: I02027676c532b447e56c8774c25015ec9a40b414
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-keystone refs/changes/88/626488/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Use s3token proveded by swift3 instead of keystonemiddleware

As of swift3 1.11, the swift3 team took over maintenance of the
s3token middleware [1]. Following a breaking API change [2], the old
keystonemiddleware-provided version won't work anymore.

This change does not warrant a patch on master (or even stable/rocky),
as the middleware has changed homes again, this time to swift [3].

[1] https://github.com/openstack/swift3/commit/b626a3c
[2] https://github.com/openstack/swift3/commit/cd094ee
[3] https://github.com/openstack/puppet-swift/commit/bb93e6a

Change-Id: I6125f52dcba4751e2a6726101f115fded3a2b921
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-swift refs/changes/80/625080/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'filter:s3token/use': value => 'egg:swift3#s3token'; 'filter:s3token/auth_host': value => $auth_host; 'filter:s3token/auth_port': value => $auth_port; 'filter:s3token/auth_protocol': value => $auth_protocol;

commit_message:
Fix up force live migration completion docs

This change does a few things:

* Links live_migration_completion_timeout to the config
  option guide.

* Links the force complete API reference to the feature support
  matrix to see which drivers support the operation.

* Fixes the server status mentioned in the troubleshooting for
  the force complete API reference (a live migrating server
  status is MIGRATING, not ACTIVE). The same text is copied to the
  abort live migration API reference troubleshooting for
  consistency (and since using the server status is more natural than
  the task_state).

* Links to the admin guide for troubleshooting live migration
  timeouts.

Change-Id: I496d3f4b99e3d7e978c7ecb13ab3b67023fcb919
Closes-Bug: #1808579

The ``host`` value should be the public IP of the node. listening. ``host`` should be the public IP of the node, and ``rndc_host`` should be the internal_api IP of the node.
